summary.long: Numbers is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses in the desert of Sinai, in the tent of assembly, on the first of the month, in the second year after they came out of the land of Egypt, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a census of the entire community of the Israelites according to their clans and their families, according to the number of names, every male individually
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from twenty years old and above, everyone in Israel who is able to go to war. You and Aaron must muster them for their wars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man from each tribe will be with you, each man the head of his family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are the names of the men who will assist you: from Reuben, Elizur son of Shedeur;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Simeon, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Judah, Nahshon son of Amminadab;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Issachar, Nethanel son of Zuar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Zebulun, Eliab son of Helon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the descendants of Joseph: from Ephraim, Elishama son of Ammihud; from Manasseh, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Benjamin, Abidan son of Gideoni;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Dan, Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Asher, Pagiel son of Ocran;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Gad, Eliasaph son of Deuel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from Naphtali, Ahira son of Enan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the ones summoned from the community, the leaders of their ancestors’ tribes; they are the heads of Israel’s clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Aaron took these men who had been designated by name,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they summoned the entire community on the first day of the second month. And they registered themselves among their clans according to their families, according to the number of names from those twenty years old and above individually,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as Yahweh commanded Moses. And he counted them in the desert of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, every male individually from twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those who were counted from the tribe of Reuben were forty-six thousand five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the descendants of Simeon, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, those who were counted according to the number of their names, every individual male from twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those who were counted from the tribe of Simeon were fifty-nine thousand three hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the descendants of Gad, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those who were counted from the tribe of Gad were forty-five thousand six hundred and fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the descendants of Judah, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those who were counted from the tribe of Judah were seventy-four thousand six hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the descendants of Issachar, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those who were counted from the tribe of Issachar were fifty-four thousand four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the descendants of Zebulun, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those who were counted from the tribe of Zebulun were fifty-seven thousand four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the descendants of Joseph: from the descendants of Ephraim, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those who were counted from the tribe of Ephraim were forty thousand five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the descendants of Manasseh, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those who were counted from the tribe of Manasseh were thirty-two thousand two hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the descendants of Benjamin, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those who were counted from the tribe of Benjamin were thirty-five thousand four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the descendants of Dan, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those who were counted from the tribe of Dan were sixty-two thousand seven hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the descendants of Asher, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those who were counted from the tribe of Asher were forty-one thousand five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the descendants of Naphtali, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those who were counted from the tribe of Naphtali were fifty-three thousand four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the ones counted whom Moses and Aaron mustered, with the twelve leaders of Israel, each one from his family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all those who were counted from the Israelites according to their families, from those twenty years old and above, everyone in Israel who is able to go to war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of the ones counted were six hundred and three thousand, five hundred and fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites from their ancestors’ tribe were not mustered in their midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You will not muster the tribe of Levi, and you will not take a census of them in the midst of the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will appoint them over the tabernacle of the testimony, over all its vessels, and over all that belongs to it. They will carry the tabernacle and all its vessels, and they will care for it; and they will camp around the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the tabernacle is set out, the Levites will take it down, and when encamping the tabernacle the Levites will set it up; the stranger that approaches it will be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelites will encamp, each in their own camp, and each by their own banner according to their divisions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Levites will encamp around the tabernacle of the testimony, and there will not be wrath on the community of the Israelites; and the Levites will keep the requirements of the tabernacle of the testimony.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Israelites did thus; they did everything that Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Israelites will encamp each with his standard, with a banner according to their families; they will encamp around the tent of assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ones who encamp on the eastern side, toward the sunrise, will be of the standard of the camp of Judah according to their divisions; and the leader of the descendants of Judah will be Nahshon son of Amminadab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his division and the ones counted are seventy-four thousand six hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the ones who encamp next to him will be the tribe of Issachar. And the leader of the descendants of Issachar will be Nethanel son of Zuar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his division are fifty-four thousand four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the tribe of Zebulun: the leader of the descendants of Zebulun will be Eliab son of Helon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his division and the ones counted are fifty-seven thousand four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those counted from the camp of Judah are one hundred and eighty-six thousand four hundred. They will set out first according to their divisions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The standard of the camp of Reuben will be to the south according to their divisions. The leader of the descendants will be Elizur son of Shedeur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his division and the ones counted are forty-six thousand five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those encamped next to him will be the tribe of Simeon. The leader of the descendants of Simeon will be Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his division and the ones counted are fifty-nine thousand three hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the tribe of Gad: the leader of the descendants of Gad will be Eliasaph son of Reuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his division and the ones counted are forty-five thousand six hundred and fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those counted from the camp of Reuben are one hundred and fifty-one thousand four hundred and fifty. They will set out second according to their divisions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The tent of assembly the camp of the Levites will set out in the midst of the camps; they will set out just as they encamped, each according to their standards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The standard of the camp of Ephraim according to their divisions will be to the west. The leader of the descendants of Ephraim will be Elishama son of Ammihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his division and the ones counted are forty thousand five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tribe of Manasseh will be next to him. The leader of the descendants of the tribe of Manasseh will be Camaliel son of Pedahzur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his division and the ones counted are thirty-two thousand two hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the tribe of Benjamin: the leader of the descendants of Benjamin will be Abidan son of Gideoni.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his division and the ones counted are thirty-five thousand four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those counted from the camp of Ephraim are one hundred and eighty thousand one hundred. They will set out third according to their divisions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The standard of the camp of Dan according to their divisions will be to the west. The leader of the descendants of Dan will be Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his division and the ones counted are sixty-two thousand seven hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those encamped next to him will be the tribe of Asher. The leader of the descendants of Asher will be Pagiel son of Ocran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his division and the ones counted are forty-one thousand five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the tribe of Naphtali: the leader of the descendants of Naphtali will be Ahira son of Enan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his division and the ones counted are fifty-three thousand four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the ones counted from the camp of Dan are one hundred and fifty-seven thousand six hundred. They will set out last according to their divisions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the ones counted of the Israelites according to their families; all those counted from the camps according to their divisions were six hundred and three thousand five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites were not counted in the midst of the Israelites, just as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Israelites did everything that Yahweh commanded Moses. They encamped according to their standards, and they set out each one according to their clans among their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the genealogies of Aaron and Moses at the time when Yahweh spoke to Moses on Mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the descendants of Aaron: Nadab the firstborn, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the descendants of Aaron, the priests, the anointed ones whom he consecrated as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nadab and Abihu died before Yahweh when they presented a strange fire before Yahweh in the desert of Sinai, and they had no children. Eleazar and Ithamar served as priest during the presence of Aaron their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Bring near the tribe of Levi, and set the tribe before Aaron the priest, and they will minister to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall observe his duties and the duties of the entire community before the tent of assembly, to do the work of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will keep all the vessels of the tent of assembly and the responsibilities of the Israelites, to do the work of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will give the Levites to Aaron and to his descendants; they are surely assigned to him from among the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you will count Aaron and his descendants; they will keep their priesthood, and the stranger who approaches will be put to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I myself receive the Levites from the midst of the Israelites in the place of all the firstborn of the offspring of the womb from the Israelites. The Levites will be mine
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because all the firstborn are mine; on the day of my killing all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I consecrated for myself all the firstborn in Israel, both humankind and animal; they will be mine. I am Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses in the desert of Sinai, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Muster the descendants of Levi according to their families, according to their clans. You will count every male from one month and above.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses mustered them according to the command of Yahweh, just as he commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the sons of Levi according to their names: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are the names of the sons of Gershon according to their clans: Libni and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Kohath according to their clans: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Merari according to their tribes: Mahli and Mushi. These are the clans of the Levites according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Gershon belonged the clan of the Libnites and the clan of the Shimeites; these are the clans of the Gershonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ones counted according to the number of every male from one month and above were seven thousand five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The clans of the Gershonites will camp behind the tabernacle to the west,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the leader of the family of the Gershonites is Eliasaph son of Lael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the responsibility of the descendants of Gershon in the tent of assembly is the tabernacle, and the tent covering it and the curtain of the doorway of the tent of the assembly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the hangings of the courtyard and the curtain of the doorway of the courtyard that is around the tabernacle and the altar, and its ten cords, all of its use.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Kohath belonged the clan of Amramites, the clan of the Izharites, the clan of the Hebronites, and the clan of the Uzzielites; these were the clans of the Kohathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the number of every male from one month and above there were eight thousand six hundred keeping the responsibility of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The clan of the descendants of Kohath will encamp on the side of the tabernacle to the south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leader of his family according to the clans of the Kohathites is Elizaphan the son of Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their responsibility was the ark, the table, the lampstand, the altar, and the vessels of the sanctuary, with which they ministered, and the curtain, and all of its use.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief of the leaders of the Levites was Eleazar son of Aaron the priest who had oversight of those keeping the responsibility of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Merari belonged the clan of Mahlites and the clan of the Mushites: these are the clans of Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ones counted according to the number of every male from one month and above were six thousand two hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leader of the family according to the clans of Merari is Zuriel son of Abihail; they will encamp of the side of the tabernacle to the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The responsibility of the sons of Merari was the supervision of the frames of the tabernacle, its bars, pillars, bases, and all its vessels and all its service,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the pillars around the courtyard, and their bases, pegs, and cords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those encamped before the tabernacle to the east—before the tent of assembly to the east—were Moses and Aaron and his sons; they will keep the responsibility of the sanctuary for the Israelites; and the stranger who approaches will be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those counted from the Levites whom Moses and Aaron mustered according to the word of Yahweh, according to their clans, every male from one month and above were twenty-two thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Muster every firstborn male from the Israelites from one month and above and count their names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will receive the Levites for me—I am Yahweh—in the place of all the firstborn among the Israelites, and the animals of the Levites in the place of all the firstborn among the animals among the Israelites.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses mustered all the firstborn among the Israelites just as Yahweh commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the firstborn males among the number of names from one month and above, the ones counted, were twenty-two thousand two hundred and seventy-three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Receive the Levites in the place of all the firstborn among the Israelites, and the animals of the Levites in the place of their animals; the Levites will be mine. I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the ransom of the two hundred and seventy-three of the firstborn of the Israelites who are excessive over the Levites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you will receive five shekels a person, in the sanctuary shekel; you will collect twenty gerahs per shekel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will give the money to Aaron, and to his sons the ransom of the ones who are excessive among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses received the money of the redemption from the ones who were excessive from those redeemed of the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the firstborn of the Israelites he took the money, one thousand three hundred and sixty-five shekels, in the sanctuary shekel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses gave the money of the ransom to Aaron and to his sons according to the word of Yahweh just as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a census of the descendants of Kohath from the midst of the descendants of Levi, according to their clans and their families,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from thirty years old and above, up to fifty years old, everyone who comes to the service to do the work in the tent of assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the work of the descendants of Kohath in the tent of assembly, concerning the holiness of the sanctuary:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When setting out the camp, Aaron and his sons will go and lower the curtain of the covering and cover with it the ark of the testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will put on it a covering of fine leather, and they will spread a cloth of perfect blue over it, and they will place its poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the table of the presence they will spread out a blue cloth and put on it the plates, dishes, and libation bowls, and the pitchers of the libation; and the bread of continuity will be on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will spread over it a scarlet cloth, and they will cover it with a covering of fine leather, and they will place its poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will take a blue cloth and cover the lampstand for the light source, its lamps, a pair of its tongs, its small pans, and all the vessels of its oil with which they attend to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will put it and all its vessels inside a covering of fine leather and put it on the carrying frame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over the altar of gold they will spread a blue cloth, and they will cover it with a covering of fine leather and place its poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will take all the vessels of the cultic service with which they serve in the sanctuary and put them on a blue cloth, and they will cover them with a covering of fine leather; and they will put them on the carrying frame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will remove the fat-soaked ashes from the altar and spread a purple cloth over it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they will put on it all the vessels with which they serve, the fire pans, forks, shovels, and bowls—all the vessels of the altar. They will spread on it a covering of fine leather; and they will place its poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary and all the vessels of the sanctuary when the camp sets out, the descendants of Kohath will come after to carry these, but they must not touch the sanctuary, or they will die. These are the load of the descendants of Kohath in the tent of assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Eleazar son of Aaron the priest is to supervise the oil of the light source, the incense, the regular grain offering, the oil of anointment, the supervision of all the tabernacle and all that is in it, in the sanctuary and in its vessels.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You must not cut off the tribe of the clan of the Kohathites from the midst of the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do this to them and they will live and not die when they come near the most holy things. Aaron and his sons will go and appoint them, each one to his task and burden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they must not go and look for a moment at the holy objects.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a census of the descendants of Gershon also, according to their families and clans,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from those twenty years old and above until fifty years old; you will muster them, all who come to help to do the work of the tent of assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the work of the clans of the Gershonites: to serve and to carry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will carry the curtains of the tabernacle and the tent of assembly and its covering and the covering of fine leather, which is on top of it, and the curtain of the doorway of the tent of assembly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the curtains of the courtyard, and the covering for the doorway of the gate of the courtyard, which is all around on the tabernacle and altar, and their cords and all the vessels of their work; and all that is done to them they will do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the work of the descendants of the Gershonites will be at the command of Aaron and his sons, for all they are to carry and for all their work, and you will appoint to them responsibility for all they are to carry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the work of the clan of the descendants of the Gershonites in the tent of assembly, and their responsibility lies under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the descendants of Merari according to their clans, according to their families, you will muster them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from those thirty years old and above until fifty years old; you will muster them, all who come to do the work of the tent of assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the responsibility of those who are to carry, all their work in the tent of assembly: the frames of the tabernacle and its bars, pillars, and bases,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the pillars of the courtyard all around, and their bases, pegs, and cords, with all their vessels and for all their work. You will appoint by name the vessels that they are responsible to carry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the work of the clan of the descendants of Merari, for all their work in the tent of assembly under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron mustered the leaders of the community according to the house of their families,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from those thirty years old and above until fifty years old; everyone who comes to the service to work in the tent of assembly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ones counted were two thousand seven hundred and fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were those counted of the clans of the Kohathites, everyone who served in the tent of assembly whom Moses and Aaron mustered according to the command of Yahweh by the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the descendants of Gershon counted according to their clans and according to their families,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from those thirty years old and above until fifty years old, everyone who comes to the service to work in the tent of assembly;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ones counted, according to their clans, according to their families, were two thousand six hundred and thirty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were those counted of the clans of the descendants of Gershon, everyone who serves in the tent of assembly whom Moses and Aaron mustered according to the command of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those counted of the clans of the descendants of Merari according to their clans, according to their families,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from those thirty years old and above until fifty years old, everyone who comes to the service to work in the tent of assembly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ones counted, according to their clans, were three thousand two hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were those counted of the clans of the descendants of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron mustered according to the command of Yahweh by the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those counted of the Levites whom Moses and Aaron and all the leaders of Israel mustered according to their clans, according to their families,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from those thirty years old and above until fifty years old, everyone who comes to the service to do the work of the service carrying in the tent of assembly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ones counted were eighty thousand five hundred and eighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the command of Yahweh by the hand of Moses they were mustered, each man according to his service and according to their service and according to their burden; and so they were counted by him just as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the Israelites: they must send everyone from the camp who is afflicted with a rash, everyone with a fluid discharge, and everyone unclean through contact with a corpse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will send away both male and female; you will send them outside the camp. They must not make unclean their camps where I am dwelling in their midst.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Israelites did so. They sent them away outside the camp; just as Yahweh spoke to Moses, so did the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the Israelites: ‘When a man or woman commits any of the sins of humankind by acting unfaithfully, it is a sin against Yahweh, and that person will be guilty;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they will confess their sin that they did and will make restitution for their guilt by adding a fifth to it and giving it to whomever was wronged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the man does not have a redeemer to make restitution to him for the reparation, the reparation is to be given to Yahweh for the priest, in addition to the ram of atonement by which atonement is made for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every contribution of all the holy objects of the Israelites that they bring to the priest for him will be his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The holy objects of a man will be for him; whatever he gives to the priest will be for him.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the Israelites and say to them, ‘If any man’s wife goes astray and acts unfaithfully to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a man sleeps with her and ejaculates and it is hidden from the eyes of her husband and she is concealed, although she is defiled, and there is no witness against her and she was not caught,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if a spirit of jealousy comes over him, and he is jealous of his wife and she is defiled; or if a spirit of jealousy comes over him and he is jealous of his wife but she is not defiled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he will bring his wife to the priest. And he will bring her offering for her, one-tenth of an ephah of flour. He will not pour oil on it, and he will not put frankincense on it because it is a grain offering of jealousy, a grain offering of remembering, a reminding of guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Then the priest will bring her near and present her before Yahweh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the priest will take holy waters in a clay vessel, and from the dust that is on the floor of the tabernacle, and the priest will put it into the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest will present the woman before Yahweh, and he will uncover the head of the woman; he will then put in her hands the grain offering of the remembering—which is the grain offering of jealousy—and in the hand of the priest will be the waters of bitterness that brings a curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest will make her swear an oath, and he will say to the woman, “If a man has not slept with you, and if you have not had an impurity affair under your husband, go unpunished from the waters of bitterness that brings this curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you have had an affair under your husband, and if you are defiled and a man other than your husband had intercourse with you,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the priest will make the woman swear an oath of the sworn oath of the curse, the priest will say to the woman, “May Yahweh give you a curse and a sworn oath in the midst of your people with Yahweh making your hip fall away and your stomach swollen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and these waters that bring a curse will go into your intestines to cause your womb to swell and to make your hip fall away.” And the women will say, “Amen. Amen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And the priests will write these curses on the scroll, and he will wipe them off into the waters of the bitterness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will make the woman drink the waters of the bitterness that brings a curse, and the waters of bitterness that bring a curse will go into her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will take the grain offering of jealousy from the hand of the woman, and he will wave the grain offering before Yahweh, and he will present it to the altar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the priest will grasp her memorial offering from the grain offering, and he will turn it into smoke on the altar, and afterward he will make the woman drink the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he has made her drink the waters, it will come about, if she has defiled herself and acted unfaithfully to her husband and the waters of bitterness that bring a curse go into her and her stomach swells and her hip falls away, the woman will be as a curse in the midst of her people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if the woman is not defiled, and she is pure, she will go unpunished and be able to conceive children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘This is the regulation of jealousy, when a woman has an affair under her husband and she is defiled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or when a spirit of jealousy comes over a man and he is jealous of his wife, he will present the woman before Yahweh,and the priest will do to her all of this law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man will go unpunished from guilt, and the woman, she will bear her guilt.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the Israelites and say to them, ‘When a man or a woman takes a special vow, a vow of a Nazirite, to keep separate for Yahweh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he will abstain from wine and fermented drink; he will not drink wine vinegar or vinegar of fermented drink; he will not drink the fruit juice of grapes or eat fresh or dry grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the days of his separation you will not eat from anything that is made from the grapevine, from sour grapes to the skin of grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘All the days of the vow of his separation a razor will not pass over his head. Until fulfilling the days that he separated himself to Yahweh he will be holy and grow long the locks of the hair of his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘All the days of keeping himself separated for Yahweh he will not go to a person who is dead;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for even his father, mother, brother, or sister he will not make himself unclean by their death, because the separation to his God is on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be holy for Yahweh all the days of his separation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘If someone dies suddenly and makes the head of his separation unclean, he will shave off the hair of his head on the day of his cleansing; on the seventh day he will shave it off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day he will bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the priest by the doorway of the tent of assembly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest will offer one for a sin offering and one for a burnt offering, and he will make atonement for him because he sinned concerning the corpse. He will consecrate his head on that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will rededicate to Yahweh the days of his separation and bring a ram-lamb in its first year as a guilt offering. The former days of his vow will fall away because his separation was defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘This is the regulation of the Nazirite for the day of the fulfilling of the days of his separation: one will bring him to the doorway of the tent of the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will present his offering to Yahweh, one ram-lamb in its first year without defect as a burnt offering, and one ewe-lamb in its first year without defect as a sin offering, and one ram without defect as a fellowship offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a basket of unleavened bread, finely milled flour of ring-shaped bread cakes mixed with oil, and wafers of unleavened bread smeared with oil, and their grain offering and their libations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will present before Yahweh and offer his sin offering, his burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he will offer a ram as a sacrifice of a fellowship offering to Yahweh, in addition to the basket of the unleavened bread; the priest will offer his grain offering and his libation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Nazirite will shave off the hair of his consecrated head at the doorway of the tent of assembly, and he will take the hair of his consecrated head, and he will put it on the fire that is beneath the sacrifice of the fellowship offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will take the shoulder from the ram that is boiled, and one ring-shaped bread cake of unleavened bread from the basket, and one wafer of unleavened bread, and he will put them on the hands of the Nazirite after he has shaved his consecrated head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will wave them as a wave offering before the presence of Yahweh; they are a holy object to the priest, in addition to the breast section of the wave offering, and in addition to the upper thigh of the contribution; and afterward the Nazirite may drink wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘This is the regulation of the Nazirite who has made a vow of his offering to Yahweh according to his separation, in addition to what he can afford. In accordance to the word of his vow that he vowed, he will do, concerning the instruction of his separation.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to Aaron and his sons, saying, ‘You will bless the Israelites: You will say to them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh will bless you
    and keep you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh will make shine his face on you
    and be gracious to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh will lift up his face upon you,
    and he will give you peace.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will put my name on the Israelites, and I will bless them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day Moses finished setting up the tabernacle and appointed and consecrated it and all its vessels, and the altar and its vessels, and he appointed them and consecrated them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the leaders of Israel, the heads of the families, presented an offering; they were the leaders of the tribes and were the ones in charge of the counting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought their offering before the presence of Yahweh, six covered utility carts and twelve cattle, a utility cart for two of the leaders, and a bull for each; and they presented them before the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take them, and they will be used to do the work of the tent of the assembly; and you will give them to the Levites, each according to his required service.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses took the utility carts and the cattle, and he gave them to the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two utility carts and four cattle he gave to the descendants of Gershon according to their required service;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and four utility carts and eight cattle he gave to the descendants of Merari according to their required service, under the authority of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to the descendants of Kohath he did not give anything because the work of the sanctuary they carried upon them on their shoulders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leaders presented offerings for the dedication of the altar on the day of its anointing, and the leaders presented their offerings before the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Moses, “One leader for each day will present their offering for the dedication of the altar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened, the one who presented his offering on the first day was Nahshon son of Amminadab from the tribe of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering was one plate of silver—its weight was one hundred and thirty shekels—and one silver bowl weighing seventy shekels according to the sanctuary shekel, both of them filled with finely milled flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish weighing ten shekels filled with incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, one male lamb in its first year as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one he-goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as a sacrifice of the fellowship offering, two cattle, five rams, five he-goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Nahshon son of Amminadab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the second day Nethanel son of Zuar, leader of Issachar, presented an offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He presented as his offering one silver plate—its weight one hundred and thirty shekels—and one silver bowl for drinking wine weighing seventy shekels according to the sanctuary shekel, both of them filled with finely milled flour mixed with oil as a grain offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One dish weighing ten shekels filled with incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, a male lamb in its first year as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one he-goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of the fellowship offering, two cattle, five rams, five he-goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Nethanel son of Zuar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the third day Eliab son of Helon, leader of the descendants of Zebulun:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate—its weight one hundred and thirty shekels—and one silver bowl for drinking wine weighing seventy shekels according to the sanctuary shekel, both of them filled with finely milled flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish weighing ten shekels filled with incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, a male lamb in its first year as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one he-goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of the fellowship offering, two cattle, five rams, five he-goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Eliab son of Helon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fourth day Elizur son of Shedeur, leader of the descendants of Reuben:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate—its weight one hundred and thirty shekels—and one silver bowl for drinking weighing seventy shekels according to the sanctuary shekel, both of them filled with finely milled flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish weighing ten shekels filled with incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, a male lamb in its first year as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one he-goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of the fellowship offering, two cattle, five rams, five he-goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Elizur son of Shedeur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fifth day Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai, leader of the descendants of Simeon:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate—its weight one hundred and thirty shekels—and one silver bowl for drinking weighing seventy shekels according to the sanctuary shekel, both of them filled with finely milled flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish weighing ten shekels filled with incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, a male lamb in its first year as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one he-goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of the fellowship offering, two cattle, five rams, five he-goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the sixth day Eliasaph son of Deuel, leader of the descendants of Gad:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate—its weight one hundred and thirty shekels—and one silver bowl for drinking weighing seventy shekels according to the sanctuary shekel, both of them filled with finely milled flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish weighing ten shekels filled with incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, a male lamb in its first year as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one he-goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of the fellowship offering, two cattle, five rams, five he-goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Eliasaph son of Deuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day Elishama son of Ammihud, leader of the descendants of Ephraim:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate—its weight one hundred and thirty shekels—and one silver bowl for drinking weighing seventy shekels according to the sanctuary shekel, both of them filled with finely milled flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish weighing ten shekels filled with incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, a male lamb in its first year as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one he-goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of the fellowship offering, two cattle, five rams, five he-goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Elishama son of Ammihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day Gamaliel son of Pedahzur, leader of the descendants of Manasseh:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate—its weight one hundred and thirty shekels—and one silver bowl for drinking weighing seventy shekels according to the sanctuary shekel, both of them filled with finely milled flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish weighing ten shekels filled with incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, a male lamb in its first year as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one he-goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of the fellowship offering, two cattle, five rams, five he-goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the ninth day Abidan son of Gideoni, leader of the descendants of Benjamin:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate—its weight one hundred and thirty shekels—and one silver bowl for drinking weighing seventy shekels according to the sanctuary shekel, both of them filled with finely milled flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish weighing ten shekels filled with incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, a male lamb in its first year as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one he-goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of the fellowship offering, two cattle, five rams, five he-goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Abidan son of Gideoni.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the tenth day Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai, leader of the descendants of Dan:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate—its weight one hundred and thirty shekels—and one silver bowl for drinking weighing seventy shekels according to the sanctuary shekel, both of them filled with finely milled flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish weighing ten shekels filled with incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, a male lamb in its first year as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one he-goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of the fellowship offering, two cattle, five rams, five he-goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eleventh day Pagiel son of Ocran, leader of the descendants of Asher:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate—its weight one hundred and thirty shekels—and one silver bowl for drinking weighing seventy shekels according to the sanctuary shekel, both of them filled with finely milled flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish weighing ten shekels filled with incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, a male lamb in its first year as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one he-goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of the fellowship offering, two cattle, five rams, five he-goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Pagiel son of Ocran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the twelfth day Ahira son of Enan, leader of the descendants of Naphtali:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate—its weight one hundred and thirty shekels—and one silver bowl for drinking weighing seventy shekels according to the sanctuary shekel, both of them filled with finely milled flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish weighing ten shekels filled with incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, a male lamb in its first year as a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one he-goat as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of the fellowship offering, two cattle, five rams, five he-goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Ahira son of Enan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the dedication of the altar on the day of anointing it, from the leaders of Israel: twelve silver plates, twelve silver bowls for drinking wine, twelve golden dishes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: each plate of silver weighed one hundred and thirty shekels, and each bowl for drinking seventy, all the silver of the vessels two thousand four hundred shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twelve golden dishes filled with incense, each dish weighing ten shekels according to the sanctuary shekel, all the gold of the dishes one hundred and twenty;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the cattle for the burnt offering twelve bulls, twelve rams, twelve male lambs in their first year, and their grain offering; and twelve he-goats as a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the cattle of the sacrifice of the fellowship offering twenty-four bulls, sixty rams, sixty he-goats, sixty male lambs in their first year. These were the dedication of the altar after its anointing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Moses came to the tent of assembly to speak with him, he would hear the voice speaking to him from the atonement cover, which is on the ark of the testimony, from between the two cherubim, and he would speak to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to Aaron, and say to him: ‘When you are setting up the lamps, the seven lamps will give light in front of the face of the lampstand.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron did so; he set up the lampstand in front of the face of its lamps, just as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is how the lampstand was made, a hammered-work of gold; from its base up to its blossom, it was hammered-work according to the pattern that Yahweh showed Moses; so he made the lampstand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the Levites from the midst of the Israelites and purify them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you will do to them, to purify them: sprinkle on them waters of purification, and they will shave their whole body and wash their garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will take a young bull and its grain offering of finely milled flour mixed with oil, and you will take a second young bull as a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will bring the Levites before the tent of assembly, and you will summon the entire community of the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will bring the Levites before Yahweh, and the Israelites will lay their hands on the Levites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Aaron will offer the Levites as a wave offering before Yahweh from the Israelites, and they will do the work of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Levites will lay their hands on the head of the one bull and offer it as a sin offering and the other one as a burnt offering to Yahweh, to make atonement for the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will present the Levites before Aaron and before his sons, and he will offer them as a wave offering to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you will separate the Levites from the midst of the Israelites, and the Levites will be for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after this the Levites will come to serve at the tent of assembly, and you will purify them, and you will offer them as a wave offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they are given to me exclusively from the midst of the Israelites. I have taken them for myself in place of the firstborn of every womb, every firstborn from the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every firstborn among the Israelites is mine, both humankind and animal. On the day I destroyed every firstborn in the land of Egypt I consecrated them to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have taken the Levites in the place of every firstborn among the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have given the Levites; they are given to Aaron and his sons from the midst of the Israelites to do the work of the Israelites in the tent of the assembly and to make atonement for the Israelites, so a plague will not be among the Israelites when the Israelites come near the sanctuary.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron and the entire community of the Israelites did to the Levites; everything that Yahweh commanded Moses concerning the Levites, the Israelites did to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Levites purified themselves, and they washed their garments, and Aaron offered them as a wave offering before Yahweh; and Aaron made atonement for them to purify them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this the Levites came to do their work in the tent of assembly before Aaron and his sons. Just as Yahweh commanded Moses concerning the Levities, so they did to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what is for the Levites: those twenty-five years old and above will come to help with the service in the work of the tent of assembly;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those fifty years old will return from the service of the work and will serve no longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They can attend their brothers in the tent of assembly to keep their responsibilities, but they will not do work. This is what you will do concerning the Levities and their responsibilities.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses in the desert of Sinai, in the second year after they came out from the land of Egypt, in the first month, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let the Israelites observe the Passover at its appointed time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fourteenth day of this month at twilight you will perform it at its appointed time according to all its decrees; and according to all its stipulations you will observe it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses spoke to the Israelites to observe the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they observed the Passover on the fourteenth day of the month at twilight in the desert of Sinai. According to all that Yahweh commanded Moses, thus the Israelites did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened, men who were unclean by a dead person were not able to perform the Passover on that day. And they came before Moses and Aaron on that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those men said to him, “Although we are unclean by a dead person, why are we hindered from presenting the offering of Yahweh at its appointed time in the midst of the Israelites?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to them, “Stay. I will hear what Yahweh commands to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the Israelites, saying, ‘Each man that is unclean by a dead person or is on a far journey, you or your descendants, he will observe the Passover of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the second month on the fourteenth day at twilight they will observe it; they will eat it with unleavened bread and bitter plants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will leave none of it until morning, and they will not break a bone in it; they will observe it according to every decree of the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the man who is clean and not on a journey, and he fails to observe the Passover, that person will be cut off from the people because he did not present the offering of Yahweh on its appointed time. That man will bear his guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If an alien dwells with you he will observe the Passover of Yahweh according to the decree of the Passover and according to its stipulation; thus you will have one decree for you, for the alien and for the native of the land.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on a day setting up the tabernacle, the cloud covered the tent of the tabernacle, the tent of the testimony; in the evening it was on the tabernacle as an appearance of fire until morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it was continually; the cloud would cover it and the appearance of fire by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever the cloud lifted up from on the tent, after that the Israelites would set out, and in the place where the cloud dwelled, there the Israelites camped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the command of Yahweh the Israelites would set out, and on the command of Yahweh they encamped; all the days that the cloud dwelled on the tabernacle they encamped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the cloud prolonged on the tabernacle many days the Israelites kept the kept requirement of Yahweh and did not set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the cloud remained a number of days on the tabernacle, on the command of Yahweh they encamped; and on the command of Yahweh they set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the cloud remained from evening until morning, and the cloud lifted up in the morning, they would set out, or if it remained in the daytime and at night, when the cloud lifted up they set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was two days, a month, or a year that the cloud prolonged to dwell on the tabernacle, the Israelites encamped, and they did not set out; when it lifted up they set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the command of Yahweh they encamped, and on the command of Yahweh they set out. They kept the requirement of Yahweh, on the command of Yahweh in the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Make yourself two silver trumpets; make them of hammered-work. You will use them for calling the community and for breaking the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will blow them, and all the community will assemble to the doorway of the tent of assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they blow only one, the leaders, the heads of the thousands of Israel, will assemble to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you will blow a blast, the camps that are camping on the east will set out;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when you blow a second blast, the camps that are camping on the south will set out; they will blow a blast for their journeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when summoning the assembly, you will blow, but you will not signal with a loud noise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Aaron, the priests, will blow on the trumpets; this will be an eternal decree for your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you go to war in your land against the enemy who attacks you, you will signal with a loud noise on the trumpets. You will be remembered before Yahweh your God, and you will be rescued from your enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And on the day of your joy and in your appointed times, at the beginning of your months, you will blow on the trumpets in addition to your burnt offerings and in addition to the sacrifices of your fellowship offerings. And they will be as a memorial for you before your God; I am Yahweh your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened, in the second year, in the second month, on the twentieth of the month the cloud was lifted from upon the tabernacle of the testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Israelites set out for their journey from the desert of Sinai, and the cloud dwelled in the desert of Paran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out for the first time on the command of Yahweh in the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The standard of the camp of the descendants of Judah set out for the first time according to their divisions, with Nahshon son of Amminadab over its division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Nathanel son of Zuar was over the division of the descendants of Issachar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliab son of Helon was over the division of the tribe of the descendants of Zebulun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tabernacle was taken down, and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari, the bearers of the tabernacle, set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the standard of the camp of Reuben according to their divisions; Elizur son of Shedeur was over their division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai was over the division of the sons of the tribe of Simeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliasaph son of Deuel was over the division of the tribe of the descendants of Gad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Kohathites, the bearers of the sanctuary, set out, and they set up the tabernacle before they arrived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the stand of the camp of the descendants of Ephraim set out according to their divisions; Elishama son of Ammihud was over its division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gamaliel son of Pedahzur was over the division of the tribe of the descendants of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abidan son of Gideoni was over the division of the tribe of the descendants of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the standard of the camp of the descendants of Dan, who formed a rear guard for all the camps, set out according to their divisions; Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai was over its division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pagiel son of Ocran was over the division of the tribe of the descendants of Asher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahira son of Enan was over the division of the tribe of the descendants of Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the departures of the Israelites according to their divisions; and so they set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to Hobab son of Reuel the Midianite, the father-in-law of Moses, “We are setting out to the place that Yahweh said, ‘I will give it to you’; go with us, and we will treat you well because Yahweh promised good concerning Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to him, “I will not go. I will only go to my land and to my family.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Please, do not abandon us because you know our encampment in the desert, and you should be our guide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, if you go with us, the good that Yahweh will do to us we will do to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so they set out from the mountain of Yahweh a journey of three days, with the ark of the covenant of Yahweh setting out ahead of them three days’ journey to search out a resting place for them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the cloud of Yahweh was over them by day when they set out from the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And whenever the ark was setting out Moses would say,
“Rise up, Yahweh!
May your enemies be scattered;
may the ones that hate you flee from your presence.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And when it rested he would say,
“Return, Yahweh,
to the countless thousands of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened, the people were like those who complain of hardship in the hearing of Yahweh, and Yahweh became angry, and the fire of Yahweh burned among them, and it consumed the edge of the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people cried out to Moses, and Moses prayed to Yahweh, and the fire died down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called the name of that place Taberah because the fire of Yahweh burned among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The riff-raff that were in their midst had a strong desire; and the Israelites turned back and also wept, and they said, “Who will feed us meat?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We remember the fish that we ate in Egypt for nothing, the cucumber, melon, leek, the onions, and the garlic.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now our strength is dried up; there is nothing whatsoever except for the manna before us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the manna was like coriander seed, and its outward appearance was like that of bdellium-gum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people went about and gathered it, and they ground it with mills or crushed it with mortar. Then they boiled it in a pot and made it into bread-cakes; and it tasted like olive oil cakes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the dew came down on the camp at night, the manna came down with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses heard the people weeping according to their clans, each at the doorway of their tents. Then Yahweh became very angry, and in the eyes of Moses it was bad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to Yahweh, “Why have you brought trouble to your servant? Why have I not found favor in your eyes, that the burdens of all these people have been placed on me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did I conceive all these people? If I have fathered them, that you could say to me, ‘Carry them in your lap, just as a foster-father carries the suckling on the land that you swore an oath to their ancestors?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From where do I have meat to give all these people? They weep before me, saying, ‘Give us meat and let us eat!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am not able to carry all these people along alone; they are too heavy for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If this is how you are going to treat me, please kill me immediately if I find favor in your eyes, and do not let me see my misery.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Gather for me seventy men from the elders of Israel whom you know are elders of the people and their officials; take them to the tent of assembly, and they will stand there with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will come down and speak with you there; I will take away from the spirit that is on you, and I will place it on them; and they will bear the burdens of the people with you; you will not bear it alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will say to the people, ‘Sanctify yourselves tomorrow, for you will eat meat because you have wept in the ears of Yahweh, saying, “Who will feed us good meat? It was good for us in Egypt.” Yahweh will give to you meat, and you will eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will eat, not one day, or two days, or five days, or ten days, or twenty days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but for a whole month, until it comes out from your nose and becomes as nausea to you; because you have rejected Yahweh, who is in your midst, and you wept before his presence, saying, “Why did we ever leave Egypt?”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said, “There are six hundred thousand on foot, among whom I am in the midst, and you yourself said, ‘I will give meat to them, and they will eat for a whole month.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should flocks and cattle be slaughtered for them? Should all the fish of the sea be gathered together for them, to be enough for them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Is Yahweh’s power limited? Now you will see if my word will happen or not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went out, and he spoke the words of Yahweh to the people, and he gathered together seventy men from the elders of the people, and he made them stand all around the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh went down in the cloud and spoke to him, and he took away the spirit that was on him, and he put it on the seventy elders. And as soon as the spirit was resting on them they prophesied, but they did not do it again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But two men were left in the camp; the name of one was Eldad, and the name of the second was Medad, and the spirit rested on them; they were among those who were written down, but they did not go out to the tent, so they prophesied in the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So a boy ran and told Moses and said, “Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joshua son of Nun, the assistant of Moses from time of his youth, answered, “Moses, my lord, stop them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said to him, “Are you jealous for my sake? Would that he give all Yahweh’s people prophets, that Yahweh put his spirit on them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and the elders of Israel were gathered to the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a wind set out from Yahweh, and it drove quails from the west, and he spread them out on the camp about a day’s journey on one side and about a day’s journey on the other, all around the camp, about two cubits on the surface of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so the people worked all day and all night and all the next day, and they gathered the quail (the least of the ones collecting gathered ten homers).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the meat was still between their teeth, before it was consumed, Yahweh was angry with the people, and Yahweh struck a very great plague among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called the name of that place Kibroth Hattaavah because they buried the people that were greedy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Kibroth Hattaavah the people set out to Hazeroth; and they stayed in Hazeroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman whom he took (because he took a Cushite wife);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they said, “Has Yahweh spoken only through Moses? Has not Yahweh also spoken through us?” And Yahweh heard it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the man, Moses, was more humble than any other person on the face of the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Yahweh said suddenly to Moses, Aaron, and Miriam, “Go out, you three, to the tent of assembly.” So the three of them when out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh went down in a column of cloud and stood at the doorway of the tent, and he called Aaron and Miriam, and the two of them went,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and he said,
“Please hear my words:
    If there is a prophet among you, I, Yahweh,
will make myself known to him in a vision.
    I will speak to him in a dream.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Not so with my servant Moses;
    in all my house he is faithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will speak to him mouth to mouth,
    in clearness, not in riddles;
and he will look at the form of Yahweh.
Why were you not afraid to speak against my servant, against Moses?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh became very angry with them, and he went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the cloud departed from on the tent, and behold, Miriam was infected with a skin disease white like snow; when Aaron turned toward Miriam, behold, she was afflicted with a skin disease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Aaron said to Moses, “Please, my lord, please do not put on us this sin in which we were foolish and in which we have sinned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please do not let her be like the dead, whose flesh is half consumed when coming out from the womb of its mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses cried to Yahweh, saying, “God, please heal her!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Yahweh said to Moses, “If her father had surely spit in her face, would she not bear her shame for seven days? Let her be confined for seven days to an outside place of the camp, and afterward she may be gathered.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Miriam was confined to the outside place of the camp seven days, and the people did not set out until Miriam was gathered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And afterward the people set out from Hazeroth, and they encamped in the desert of Paran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator
