verses.text: “Send for yourself men, and let them explore the land of Canaan, which I am about to give to the Israelites; from each tribe of his father send one man, everyone a leader among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses sent them from the desert of Paran on the command of Yahweh; all of the men were leaders of the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are their names: from the tribe of Reuben, Shammua son of Zaccur;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat son of Hori;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Issachar, Igal son of Joseph;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea son of Nun;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Benjamin, Palti son of Raphu;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel son of Sodi;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Joseph, from the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi son of Susi;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Dan, Ammiel son of Gemalli;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Asher, Sethur son of Michael;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi son of Vophsi;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Gad, Geuel son of Maki.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the men whom Moses sent to explore the land. And Moses called Hoshea son of Nun Joshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses sent them to explore the land of Canaan, and he said to them, “Go up like this to the Negev, and go up into the hill country,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you will see what the land is like and if the people who inhabit it are strong or weak, or whether they are few or many,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whether the land that they are inhabiting is good or bad, and whether the cities they are inhabiting are camps or fortifications,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whether the land is fertile or lean, and whether there are trees on it or not. You will show yourself courageous, and you will take some of the fruit of the land.” It was the time of first ripe grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went up and explored the land from the desert of Zin until Rehob, at Lebo Hamath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went up through the Negev and came to Hebron, where Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai the descendants of the Anakites were. (Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came up to the valley of Eshcol, and they cut off a vine branch and one cluster of grapes from there; they carried it on a pole between two men, with pomegranates and figs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That place he called the valley of Eshcol on account of the cluster of grapes that the Israelites cut off from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They returned from exploring the land at the end of forty days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to Moses and Aaron and to the entire community of the Israelites in the desert of Paran at Kadesh; they brought back word to them and to all the community, and they showed them the fruit of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they told him, “We came to the land that you sent us, and it is flowing of milk and honey; this is its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the people who are inhabiting it are strong and the cities are fortified and very large; moreover, we saw the descendants of the Anakites there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Amalekites are living in the land of the Negev; the Hittites, Jebusites, and the Amorites are living in the hill country; and the Canaanites are living at the sea and on the banks of the Jordan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Caleb silenced the people before Moses and said, “Surely, let us go up and let us take possession of it because surely we will be able to prevail over it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men who went up with him said, “We are not able to go up to the people because they are stronger than us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they presented the report of the land that they explored to the Israelites, saying, “The land that we went through to explore is a land that eats its inhabitants, and all the people whom we saw in its midst are men of great size.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There we saw the Nephilim (the descendants of Anak came from the Nephilim), and we were like grasshoppers in our own sight, and so we were in their eyes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the community lifted up their voices, and the people wept during that night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the Israelites grumbled against Moses and Aaron, and all the community said to them, “If only we had died in the land of Egypt or in this desert!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why did Yahweh bring us into this land to fall by the sword? Our wives and our little children will become plunder; would it not be better for us to return to Egypt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to each other, “Let us appoint a leader, and we will return to Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before the assembly of the community of the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, from the explorers of the land, tore their garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to all the community of the Israelites, “The land that we went through to explore is an exceptionally good land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If Yahweh delights in us, then he will bring us into this land, and he will give it to us, a land that is flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only do not rebel against Yahweh, and you will not fear the people of the land, because they will be our food. Their protection has been turned from them; Yahweh is with us. You should not fear them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the community said to stone them with stones, but the glory of Yahweh appeared in the tent of assembly among the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said to Moses, “How long until this people will despise me, and how long until they will not believe in me, and in all the signs that I have done in their midst?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will strike them with disease, and I will dispossess them; I will make you into a greater and stronger nation than them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to Yahweh, “Then the Egyptians will hear that you brought up this people from their midst in your power,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they will tell it to the inhabitants of this land. They heard that you, Yahweh, are in the midst of this people, that you are seen eye to eye, and your cloud is standing over them, and in a column of cloud you go before them by day and in a column of fire at night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you destroy this people all at once, the nations that will have heard your message will say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Yahweh was unable to bring this people in the land that he swore by an oath, and he slaughtered them in the desert.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now, please, let the power of my Lord be great, just has you spoke,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Yahweh is slow to anger
    and great of loyal love,
forgiving sin and rebellion;
    but surely he leaves nothing unpunished,
visiting the sin of the fathers on the sons
    to the third and fourth generations.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please forgive the sin of this people according to the greatness of your loyal love, just as you forgave this people, from Egypt until now.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said, “I have forgiven them according to your word;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but as I am alive, the glory of Yahweh will fill all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because all the men who have seen my glory and my signs that I did in Egypt and in the desert yet tested me these ten times and did not listen to my voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they will not see the land that I swore by oath to their ancestors, and all those who despised me will not see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But my servant Caleb, because another spirit was with him, he remained true after me, and I will bring him into the land that he entered, and his offspring will take possession of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Amalekites and the Canaanites live in the valleys; tomorrow turn and set out for the desert by way of the Red Sea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How long will I bear this evil community who are grumbling against me? I have heard the grumbling of the Israelites which they are making against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to them, ‘Surely as I live,’ declares Yahweh, ‘just as you spoke in my hearing, so I will do to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in this desert your corpses will fall, and all your counted ones, according to all your number, from twenty years old and above who grumbled against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You yourselves will not come into the land that I swore by oath to make you to dwell in it, but Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But your little children, whom you said would be plunder, I will bring them, and they will know the land that you rejected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But for you, all your corpses will fall in this desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And your children will be shepherds in the desert forty years, and you will bear your unfaithfulness until all your corpses have fallen in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the number of the days that you explored the land, forty days, a day for each year, you will bear your sins forty years, and you will know my opposition.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Yahweh, have spoken; I will surely do this to all this evil community who has banded together against me. In this desert they will come to an end, and there they will die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the men whom Moses sent to explore the land, who returned and made the community grumble against him by spreading a report over the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the men who spread the evil report of the land died by the plague before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh lived from among the men who went to explore the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses spoke words to all the Israelites, and the people mourned greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They rose early in the morning and went to the top of the mount, saying, “Here we are. We will go up to the place that Yahweh said, because we have sinned.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said, “Why are you going against the command of Yahweh? It will not succeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You should not go up because Yahweh is not in your midst; do not let yourselves be defeated in the presence of your enemies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the Amalekites and the Canaanites are there before you, and you will fall by the sword; because you have turned back from Yahweh, and Yahweh will not be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they dared to go to the top of the mountain, and the ark of the covenant of Yahweh and Moses did not depart from the midst of the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Amalekites and the Canaanites who were living on the mountain descended, and they beat them down, up to Hormah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the Israelites and say to them, ‘When you come into the land of your dwellings that I am about to give to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you will make an offering by fire for Yahweh from the cattle or from the flock, a burnt offering or a sacrifice to fulfill a vow, or as a freewill offering or at your feasts, to make a fragrance of appeasement for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one who presents an offering for Yahweh, he will present a grain offering of finely milled flour; a tenth will be mixed with a fourth of the liquid measure of oil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you will add a fourth of wine for the libation upon the burnt offering, or to the sacrifice for each ram-lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or for the ram you will make a grain offering of two-tenths of finely milled flour mixed into a third of a liquid measure of oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will present a third of the liquid measure of wine for the libation, a fragrance of appeasement for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you prepare a bull as a burnt offering or a sacrifice to fulfill a vow or a fellowship offering for Yahweh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you will present with the bull a grain offering of three-tenths of finely milled flour mixed with half a liquid measure of oil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you will present half a liquid measure of wine as a libation, as an offering made by fire, a fragrance of appeasement for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘This is how it should be done for each bull, or for the each ram, or for the small four-footed mammal, or ram-lambs, or goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the number that you prepare, so should you do to each according to their number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every native must do these things to present an offering made by fire, a fragrance of appeasement for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If an alien dwells among you, or whoever is in your midst throughout your generations, and prepares an offering made by fire, a fragrance of appeasement for Yahweh, he should do as you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the assembly, there will be one decree for you and for the alien who dwells among you; it is an eternal decree for all your generations. You as well as the alien will be before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be one law and one stipulation for you and for the alien dwelling among you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the Israelites and say to them, ‘When you come into the land to which I am about to bring you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whenever you eat from the food of the land, you will lift up a contribution to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must lift up a contribution of the first batch of your ring-shaped dough bread; you must lift it up as a contribution of the threshing floor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will give to Yahweh a contribution from the first of your dough throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘But if you go astray and you do not follow all these commandments that Yahweh commanded to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all that Yahweh commanded you by the hand of Moses from the day that Yahweh commanded and beyond, throughout your generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if it was done unintentionally without the knowledge of the community, then the entire community must prepare one young bull as a burnt offering, as a fragrance of appeasement for Yahweh, and its grain offering and its libation, according to the stipulation, and one male goat as a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will make atonement for all of the community of the Israelites, and they will be forgiven because it was unintentional; they will bring their offering, an offering made by fire for Yahweh, their sin offering before Yahweh for their unintentional sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of the community of the Israelites will be forgiven, as well as the alien that dwells in their midst, because the whole community was involved in the unintentional wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘If one person sins unintentionally, that person will present a female goat in its first year as a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest will make atonement for the person who sinned unintentionally before Yahweh, to make atonement for him, and he will be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the native among the Israelites and the alien that dwells in their midst, there will be one law for anyone who commits an unintentional wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who acts presumptuously from among the native or alien blasphemes against Yahweh, and that person must be cut off from the midst of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because he despised the word of Yahweh and broke his command, that person will be surely cut off and bear the guilt.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Israelites were in the desert, they found a man who was gathering wood on the day of the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ones who found him gathering wood brought him to Moses, Aaron, and to all the community.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they put him under watch because it was not made clear what should be done to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Surely the man must be put to death by stoning him; all the community must stone him with stones from outside the camp.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the entire community brought him out to a place outside the camp, and they stoned him to death just as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the Israelites, and tell them to make for themselves tassels on the hems of their garments throughout their generations and to put a blue cord on the tassel of the hem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will have a tassel for you to look at and remember all the commands of Yahweh and do them, and not follow after the unfaithfulness of your own heart and eyes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you will remember and do all my commandments, and you will be holy for your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am Yahweh your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God; I am Yahweh your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Korah son of Izhar, son of Kohath, son of Levi, and Dathan and Abiram sons of Eliab, and On son of Peleth, the descendants of Reuben,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: took two hundred and fifty men from the Israelites, leaders of the community summoned from the assembly, renowned men, and they confronted Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were assembled in front of Moses and Aaron, and they said to them, “You take too much upon yourselves! All of the community is holy, every one of them, and Yahweh is in their midst, so why do you raise yourselves over the assembly of Yahweh?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses heard this, he fell on his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to Korah and to his entire company, saying, “Tomorrow morning Yahweh will make known who is his and who is holy, and he will bring him near to him, whomever he chooses he will bring near to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do this: take for yourselves censers, Korah and all of your company;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: tomorrow put fire in them and place incense on them before Yahweh; the man whom Yahweh chooses will be the holy one. You take too much upon yourselves, sons of Levi!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to Korah, “Please listen, sons of Levi!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it too little for you that the God of Israel set you apart from the community of Israel to allow you to approach him to do the work of the tabernacle of Yahweh, to stand before the community to serve them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has allowed you to approach him, you with all your brothers, the descendants of Levi, but yet you also seek the priesthood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you and your company that has banded together against Yahweh. What is Aaron that you grumble against him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses sent to call for Dathan and Abiram son of Eliab, but they said, “We will not come!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it too little that you have brought us from a land that flows with milk and honey to kill us in the desert, and that you also appoint yourself as a ruler over us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely, you have not brought us to a land that flows with milk and honey, and you have not given us the inheritance of fields and a vineyard. Will you gouge out the eyes of these men? We will not come!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses became angry, and he said to Yahweh, “Do not notice their grain offering. I have not offered one donkey from them, and I have not mistreated one of them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to Korah, “You and your entire company will be before Yahweh tomorrow, you and they and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each one take his censer, and put incense on it and you will present it before Yahweh, and each of you bring his censer, two hundred and fifty censers, you and Aaron, each his censer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So each of them took his censer, and they put fire on them, and they placed incense on them; they stood at the doorway of the tent of the assembly of Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Korah summoned them, the entire community, by the doorway of the tent of assembly, and the glory of Yahweh appeared to all the community.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Separate yourselves from the midst of this community, that I can destroy them in a moment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they fell on their faces, and they said, “God, God of the spirits of all flesh, will one man sin and you become angry toward the entire community?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the community, saying, ‘Move away from the dwelling of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses stood up and went to Dathan and Abiram; the elders of Israel followed after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the community, saying, “Please turn away from the tents of these wicked men, and do not touch anything that belongs to them, or you will be destroyed with all their sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so they moved away from around the dwellings of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram; and Dathan and Abiram came out standing at the doorway of their tents, with their wives, sons, and little children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, “In this you will know that Yahweh has sent me to do all these works; it is not from my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they die a natural death or if a natural fate is visited upon them, Yahweh has not sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if Yahweh creates something new, and the ground opens its mouth and swallows them up and all that belongs to them, and they go down alive to Sheol, and you will know that these men have despised Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened, as soon as he finished speaking all these words, the ground that was under them split open.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land opened its mouth and swallowed them up with their houses and every person that belonged to Korah and all the property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went down alive to Sheol, they and all that belonged to them, and the land covered over them, and they perished from the midst of the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Israel who were around them fled at their cry, because they said, “Lest the land swallow us up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And fire went out from Yahweh, and it consumed the two hundred and fifty men presenting the incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to Eleazar son of Aaron the priest, ‘Take out the censers from among the place of burning because they are sacred, and scatter the fire outside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The censers of these who have sinned at the cost of their lives, let them be made into gilded leafing plating for the altar; because they presented them before Yahweh, they are holy; and they will be a sign for the Israelites.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eleazar the priest took the bronze censers that the ones who were burned presented, and they hammered them out thinly as plating for the altar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it was a memorial for the Israelites, so that no strange man who is not from the offspring of Aaron should approach the presence of Yahweh to burn a smoke offering; he will not be like Korah and his company, just as Yahweh had spoken to him by the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day all the community of the Israelites grumbled against Moses and Aaron, saying, “You have killed the people of Yahweh!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, when the community had gathered against Moses and Aaron, they turned to the tent of assembly, and behold, the cloud covered it, and the glory of Yahweh appeared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron came to the front of the tent of assembly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get away from the midst of this community, and I will finish them in an instant,” but they fell on their faces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron said, “Take the censer, and put fire on it from the altar. Place incense on it, and bring it quickly to the community, and make atonement for them, because wrath went out from the presence of Yahweh, and a plague has begun.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so Aaron took it just as Moses had spoken, and he ran into the midst of the assembly, for behold, the plague had begun among the people; so he gave the incense and made atonement for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stood between the dead and between the living, and the plague was stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who died by the plague were fourteen thousand seven hundred, besides those who died on account of Korah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron returned to Moses at the doorway of the tent of assembly, and the plague was stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the Israelites, and take from among them twelve staffs, a staff from each family from among all their leaders according to their families’ households. Write the name of each man on his staff,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the name of Aaron on the staff of Levi, because one staff is for the head of each of their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must then put them in the tent of assembly before the testimony where I meet with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it will happen, the man whom I will choose, his staff will blossom, and so I will rid from upon myself the grumblings of the Israelites, who are grumbling against you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses spoke to the Israelites, and all their leaders gave him a staff for each leader, one from each of their families, twelve staffs, and the staff of Aaron was in the midst of their tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses put the staffs before Yahweh in the tent of testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the next day, Moses went into the tent of the testimony, and behold the staff of Aaron for the house of Levi blossomed and put forth a flower and produced blossoms, and it produced almonds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses brought out to all the Israelites all the staffs before the presence of Yahweh, and they saw, and each man took his staff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Bring back the staff of Aaron before the testimony as a guard and sign for the children of rebellion, and let them finish their grumblings before me and not die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses did; just as Yahweh commanded him, so he did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Israelites said to Moses, saying, “Look! We will die! We will be destroyed! All of us will perish!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who approaches the tabernacle of Yahweh will die. Will we all die?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Aaron, “You, your sons, and your family with you will bear the guilt of the sanctuary, and you and your sons with you will bear the guilt of your priesthood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, bring your brothers with you, the tribe of Levi the tribe of your father, that they may be joined to you and minister to you, you and your sons with you before the tent of testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will keep your responsibility and the responsibility of all the tent, only they may not come near the vessels of the sanctuary and the altar, so both you and they will not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be joined to you, and they will keep the responsibility of the tent of assembly for the entire service of the tent; a stranger may not come near you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will keep the responsibility of the sanctuary and the responsibility of the altar, and there will no longer be wrath on the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, I myself have chosen your brothers the Levites from the midst of the children. They are a gift to you given from Yahweh to perform the work of the tent of assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you with your sons will keep your priesthood to perform your priestly duties for everything at the altar and for the area behind the curtain. I give you the priesthood as a gift, but the stranger who approaches will be put to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Aaron, “Behold, I myself have given to you the responsibility of my contributions for all the holy objects of the Israelites; I have given them as a portion to you and your sons as an eternal decree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This will be for you from the sanctuary of the holy things from the fire; all of their offerings, from every grain offering, from every sin offering, and from every guilt offering which they will bring to me is a most holy thing for you and your sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will eat it in the most holy place; every male will eat it. It will be a holy object to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is also for you: the contribution of their gift of the wave offerings of the children Israel. I have given them to you and your sons and your daughters with you as an eternal decree; whoever is clean in your house may eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the finest olive oil and all the finest new wine and their best grain that they have given to Yahweh, I have given them to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The firstfruits of all that is in their land that they present to Yahweh will be for you; whoever is clean in your house may eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All consecrated possessions in Israel will be for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the first offspring of a womb of any creature that they offer to Yahweh, whether human or animal, will be yours; you will surely redeem the firstborn of the human and the unclean firstborn of the animal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As to their price of redemption, from a one-month-old you will redeem them according to your proper value, five shekels of silver according to the shekel of the sanctuary, which is twenty gerah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only the firstborn of an ox or the firstborn of a sheep or the firstborn of a goat you will not redeem; they are holy. Their blood you will sprinkle over the altar, and their fat you will turn into smoke as an offering made by fire, a fragrance of appeasement for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their flesh will be for you like the breast section of the wave offering, and it will be for you like the right upper thigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the contributions of holiness that the Israelites offer to Yahweh I have given to you and your sons and your daughters with you as an eternal decree; it is an eternal covenant of salt before Yahweh to you and your offspring with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh said to Aaron, “You will not receive an inheritance in their land, and there will not be a plot of ground for you in the midst of the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I have given to the descendants of Levi every tithe in Israel as an inheritance in return for their service, which they are doing, the work of the tent of assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelites will not come near again to the tent of assembly, or they will bear sin and die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites will perform the service of the tent of assembly, and they will bear their guilt, an eternal decree for all your generations. But they will not receive an inheritance in the midst of the Israelites
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the tithes of the Israelites that are offered to Yahweh as a contribution, I have given to the Levites as an inheritance; therefore I said to them, ‘They will not receive an inheritance in the midst of the Israelites.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You will speak to the Levites and say to them, ‘When you receive the tithe from the Israelites that I have given to you from them for your inheritance, you will present a contribution from it to Yahweh, a tithe from a tithe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your contribution will be credited to you like the grain from the threshing floor and like the produce from the press.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you will present your own contribution to Yahweh from all your tithes that you receive from the Israelites; from it you will give the contribution of Yahweh to Aaron the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From all your gifts you will present every contribution of Yahweh, from all its fat, the part that is sacred.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will say to them, ‘When you are presenting its fat, the rest will be credited to the Levites like a yield of the threshing floor and like a yield from the press.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may eat it anywhere, you and your household, because it is a wage in return for your service in the tent of assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will not bear any sin because you have presented its fat; you will not defile the holy objects of the Israelites, or you will die.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the decree of the law that Yahweh has commanded, saying, ‘Speak to the Israelites and let them take to you a red heifer without a physical defect, on which a yoke has not been placed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will give it to Eleazar the priest, and it will be brought out to a place outside the camp, and it will be slaughtered in his presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eleazar the priest will take some of its blood on his finger and spatter it toward the mouth of the tent of assembly seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heifer will be burned in his sight; its skin, its meat, and its blood, in addition to its offal, will burn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will take cedar wood, hyssop, and crimson thread, and he will throw them in the midst of the burning heifer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will wash his garments and his body in the water, and afterward he will come to the camp; the priest will be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who burns it will wash his garments and his body in water; he will be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A clean man will gather the ashes of the heifer, and he will put them in a clean place outside the camp; it will be for the community of the Israelites as a requirement for waters of impurity; it is a purification offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who gathers the ashes of the heifer will wash his garments; he will be unclean until evening. It will be an eternal decree for the Israelites and for one who dwells as an alien in their midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘The one who touches a corpse of any person will be unclean for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will purify himself on the third day, and on the seventh day he will be clean. If he does not purify himself on the third day, he will not be clean on the seventh day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who touches a corpse, the person of a human being who died, and does not purify himself, defiles the tabernacle of Yahweh, and that person will be cut off from Israel because the waters of impurity were not sprinkled on him. He will still be unclean, and uncleanness is on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘This is the law of a person who dies in a tent: everyone who comes into the tent and all who are in the tent will be unclean seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every container that is opened that does not have a lid cord on it is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone in the open field who touches one who has been slain, or a corpse, or a bone of a person, or a burial site, he will be unclean for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the unclean person they will take from the powder of the burnt purification offering, and they will put running water into a container.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A clean person will take hyssop and dip it into the water and sprinkle it on the tent and on all the objects and persons who were there, and on one who touched the bone, or the one slain, or the dead, or the burial site.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The clean person will spatter the unclean on the third day and on the seventh day; and on the seventh day he will purify him, and he will wash his garments; he will bathe in the waters, and in the evening he will be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the man who is unclean and does not purify himself, that person will be cut off from the midst of the assembly because he defiled the sanctuary of Yahweh; the water of impurity was not sprinkled on him; he is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘It will be an eternal decree for them. The one who spatters the waters of impurity will wash his garments, and the one who touches the waters of impurity will be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anything that the unclean person touches will be unclean, and the person who touches it will be unclean until the evening.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the entire community of the Israelites came to the desert of Zin on the first month, and the people stayed in Kadesh; Miriam died and was buried there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was no water for the community, and they were gathered before Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people quarreled with Moses and spoke, saying, “If only we died when our brothers were dying before Yahweh!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why have you brought the assembly of Yahweh, us and our livestock, into this desert to die here?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why have you brought us from Egypt to bring us to this bad place? It is not a place of seed or figs or vines or pomegranate trees, and there is not water to drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron went from the presence of the assembly to the doorway of the tent of assembly. They fell on their faces, and the glory of Yahweh appeared to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the staff and summon the community, you and Aaron your brother, and speak to the rock before their eyes, and it will give water. Bring out for them water from the rock, and let the community and their livestock drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses took the staff from before Yahweh just as he command him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses and Aaron summoned the assembly to the presence of the rock, and he said to them, “Please listen, you rebels; can we bring out water for you from this rock?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses lifted up his hand and struck the rock with his staff twice. And abundant water went out, and the community and their livestock drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Yahweh said to Moses and Aaron, “Because you have not trusted in me, to regard me as holy in the sight of the Israelites, you will not bring this assembly into the land that I have given to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those were the waters of Meribah, where the Israelites quarreled with Yahweh, and he showed himself holy among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Kadesh Moses sent messengers to the king of Edom: “Thus your brother Israel has said, ‘You know all the hardship that has found us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: our ancestors went down to Egypt, and we lived in Egypt a long time, and the Egyptians mistreated us and our ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we cried to Yahweh, and he heard our voice; he sent an angel and brought us out from Egypt. And look, we are in Kadesh, a city on the edge of your territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please let us go through your land. We will not go through a field or vineyard, and we will not drink water from a well. We will go along the road of the king; we will not turn aside right or left until we have gone through your territory.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Edom said to him, “You will not pass through us lest we will go out to meet you with the sword.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelites said to him, “We will go up on the main road, and if we and our livestock drink your water, we will pay for it. It is only a small matter; let us pass through on our feet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “You will not go through.” And Edom went out to meet them with a large army and a strong hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Edom refused to give Israel passage through his territory, and Israel turned aside from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Kadesh. The Israelites, the whole community, came to Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Moses and to Aaron on Mount Hor, on the boundary of the land of Edom, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let Aaron be gathered to his people; he will not come into the land that I have given to the Israelites because you rebelled against my word at the waters of Meribah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take Aaron and Eleazar his son, and take them up Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Strip off Aaron’s garments, and put them on Eleazar his son; Aaron will be gathered to his people, and he will die there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses did just as Yahweh commanded, and they went up to Mount Hor before the eyes of all the community.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses stripped off Aaron’s garments and put them on Eleazar his son. Aaron died there on the top of the mountain; and Moses and Eleazar went down from the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the community saw that Aaron died; so all the house of Israel wept for Aaron thirty days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Canaanite king of Arad, who was dwelling in the Negev, heard that Israel came along the way of Atharim; he fought against Israel and took some of them captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel made a vow to Yahweh, and they said, “If you will surely give this people into our hand, then we will destroy their cities.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh heard the voice of Israel; he gave to them the Canaanites, and they destroyed them and their cities. They called the name of the place Hormah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Mount Hor by the way of the Red Sea to go around the land of Edom; but the people became impatient along the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people spoke against God and against Moses, “Why have you brought us from Egypt to die in the desert? There is no food and no water, and our hearts detest this miserable food.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh sent among the people poisonous snakes; they bit the people, and many people from Israel died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people came to Moses and said, “We have sinned because we have spoken against Yahweh and against you. Pray to Yahweh and let him remove the snakes from among us.” So Moses prayed for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Make for yourself a snake and place it on a pole. When anyone is bitten and looks at it, that person will live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses made a snake of bronze, and he placed it on the pole; whenever a snake bit someone, and that person looked at the snake of bronze, he lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelites set out and encamped at Oboth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Oboth and encamped at Iye Abarim in the desert, which was in front of Moab toward the sunrise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they set out and encamped at the valley of Zered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they set out and encamped beyond Arnon, which is in the desert that goes out from the boundary of the Amorites, because Arnon is the boundary of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore thus it is said in the scroll of the Wars of Yahweh,
“Waheb in Suphah,
    and the wadis of Arnon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and the slope of the wadis
    that spreads out to the dwelling of Ar
and lies at the boundary of Moab.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they went to Beer, which is the water well where Yahweh spoke to Moses, “Gather the people, that I may give them water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Israel sang this song, “Arise, well water! Sing to it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Well water that the princes dug, that the leaders of the people dug, with a staff and with their rods.” And from the desert they continued to Mattanah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from Mattanah to Nahaliel, and from Nahaliel to Bamoth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from Bamoth to the valley that is in the territory of Moab, by the top of Pisgah, which overlooks the surface of the wasteland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel sent messengers to Sihon, the king of the Amorites, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let us go through your land; we will not turn aside into a field or vineyard; we will not drink well water along the way of the king until we have gone through your territory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Sihon did not allow Israel to go through his territory. Sihon gathered all his people and went out to meet Israel; he came to the desert, to Jahaz, and he fought against Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Israel struck him with the edge of the sword, and they took possession of his land from Arnon to Jabbok, until the Ammonites, because the boundary of the Ammonites was strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel took all these cities, and Israel inhabited all the cities of the Amorites, in Heshbon, and in all its environs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because Heshbon was the city of Sihon king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab and taken all his land from his hand until Arnon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus the ones who quote proverbs say,
“Come to Heshbon! Let it be built!
    And let the city of Sihon be established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because fire went out from Heshbon,
    a flame from the city of Sihon;
it consumed Ar of Moab,
    the lords of the high places of Arnon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to you, Moab!
    You have perished, people of Chemosh.
He has given his sons as fugitives,
    and his daughters into captivity,
to the king of the Amorites, Sihon.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Thus Israel lived in the land of the Amorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses sent to explore Jaazer; they captured its environs and dispossessed the Amorites who were there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they turned and went up by the way of the Bashan, and Og king of the Bashan and all his people went out to meet them for battle at Edrei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Do not fear him because I will give him and all his people and all his land into your hand. You will do to him just as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who was living in Heshbon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so they destroyed him and his sons, and all his people until they had not spared a survivor; and they took possession of his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelites set out, and they encamped on the desert-plateau of Moab, across from Jericho beyond the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak son of Zippor saw all that Israel did to the Amorites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moab was very terrified in the presence of the people because they were numerous; and Moab dreaded the presence of the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moab said to the elders of Midian, “Now the crowd will lick up all around us, like a bull devours the grass of the field.” And Balak son of Zippor was king of Moab at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent messengers to Balaam son of Beor at Pethor, which is by the river, in the land of the children of his people, to summon him, saying, “Look! A people went out from Egypt. Look! They cover the surface of the land; they are about to dwell opposite me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, please go, curse this people for me because they are stronger than me; perhaps I will be able to strike them and drive them out from the land because I know whoever you bless is blessed, and whoever you cursed is cursed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the elders of Moab and the elders of Midian went with a fee for divination in their hand; they came to Balaam and spoke the words of Balak to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Spend the night here, and I will return, and I will return word to you, just as Yahweh speaks to me.” So the princes of Moab stayed with Balaam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God came to Balaam and said, “Who are these men with you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said to God, “Balak son of Zippor, king of Moab, sent word to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Look! A people went out from Egypt. Look! They cover the surface of the land. Now, go, curse them for me. Perhaps I will be able to attack them and drive them out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God said to Balaam, “You will not go with them; you will not curse the people, because they are blessed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam got up in the morning, and he said to the princes of Balak, “Go to your land, because Yahweh refused to allow me to go with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The princes of Moab got up and went to Balak, and they said, “Balaam refused to come with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak again sent many princes, who were more honored than the former.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Balaam and said to him, “Thus says Balak son of Zippor, ‘Please, let nothing keep you from coming to me
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I will surely honor you greatly, and all that you say to me I will do. Please, come; curse this people for me.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam answered and said to the servants of Balak, “Even though Balak gives to me his house full of silver and gold, I am not able to go beyond the command of Yahweh my God to do a little or a lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now please, you also stay here the night, and let me find out again what Yahweh will say with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God came to Balaam at night, and he said to him, “If the men have come to call you, get up and go with them; but only the word that I will speak to you, you will do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Balaam got up in the morning and saddled his donkey, and he went with the princes of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God became angry because he was going, and the angel of Yahweh stood in the road as an adversary to him; he was riding on his donkey, and two servants were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The donkey saw the angel of Yahweh standing in the road with his sword drawn in his hand, and the donkey turned aside from the road and went into the field. And Balaam struck the donkey to turn her back to the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel of Yahweh stood in the narrow path of the vineyards, with a wall on either side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the donkey saw the angel of Yahweh, she pressed herself into the wall, and she pressed the foot of Balaam into the wall, so he struck her again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of Yahweh went further ahead and stood in a narrow place where there was not a way to turn aside to the right or left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the donkey saw the angel of Yahweh, she lay down under Balaam, so Balaam became angry, and he struck the donkey with his staff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh opened the mouth of the donkey, and she said to Balaam, “What did I do to you that you struck me these three times?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam said to the donkey, “Because you made a mockery of me! If only I had a sword in my hand, I would kill you right now!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The donkey said to Balaam, “Am I not your donkey on which you have ridden all your life until this day? Have I been in the habit of doing this to you?” He said, “No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh exposed the eyes of Balaam, and he saw the angel of Yahweh standing in the road with his sword drawn in his hand, and he bowed down and worshiped to his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel of Yahweh said to him, “Why have you struck this donkey three times? Look, I have come out as an adversary because your conduct is perverse before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The donkey saw me and turned aside from me these three times. If she had not turned aside from my face, then I would have killed you and kept her alive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam said to the angel of Yahweh, “I have sinned because I did not know that you were standing to meet me in the road. Now, if it is displeasing to you, I will turn back.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel of Yahweh said to Balaam, “Go with the men, but speak only the word that I will speak to you.” So Balaam went with the princes of Balak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Balak heard that Balaam was coming, he went out to meet him by the city of Moab, which was on the boundary of Aaron at the end of the territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak said to Balaam, “Did I not urgently send to meet with you? Why did you not come to me? Am I really not able to honor you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam said to Balak, “Look, I came to you now. Am I really able to speak anything at all? I speak the word that God puts in my mouth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam went with Balak, and they came to Kiriath-Huzoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak sacrificed cattle and sheep, and he sent them to Balaam and to the princes who were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened, in the morning Balak took Balaam and took him up to Bamoth-Baal, and he saw from there the end of the nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam said to Balak, “Build for me this: seven altars. And prepare for me this: seven bulls and seven rams.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak did just as Balaam spoke, and Balak offered Balaam a bull and a ram on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said to Balak, “Station yourself at your burnt offering, and I will go; perhaps Yahweh will come to meet me, and whatever he shows me I will tell to you.” So he went to a barren height.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God met with Balaam, and he said to him, “I have arranged seven altars, and I have offered a bull and a ram on the altar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh put a word in the mouth of Balaam and said, “Return to Balak, and you must speak thus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he returned to him, and behold, he was standing beside his burnt offering, he and all the leaders of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he lifted up his oracle and said,
“From Aram Balak lead me,
    from the mountains of the east the king of Moab,
‘Go for me, curse Jacob,
    and go, denounce Israel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How can I curse whom God has not cursed,
    and how can I denounce whom Yahweh has not denounced?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because from the top of the rocks I see him,
    from hilltops I watch him.
Behold, a people who dwell alone,
    they do not consider themselves among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can count the dust of Jacob,
    or as a number the fourth part of Israel?
Let my life die the death of an upright person,
    and let my end be like his!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? I took you to curse my enemies, and look, you have surely blessed them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said, “Should I not speak what Yahweh puts in my mouth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak said, “Please walk with me to another place where you will see them, but you will only see part of them and will not see all of them; and curse them for me from there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he took him to the field of Zophim to the top of Pisgah, and he built seven altars, and he offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam said to Balak, “Station yourself here at the burnt offering while I myself meet with Yahweh there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh met with Balaam, and he put a word in his mouth, and he said, “Return to Balak, and you must speak thus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to him, and behold, he was standing at his burnt offering, and the princes of Moab with him. And Balak said to him, “What has Yahweh spoken?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
God is not a man, that he should lie,
    nor a son of humankind,
that he should change his mind.
    Has he said, and will he not do it?
And has he spoken, and will he not fulfill it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I have received a command to bless;
when he has blessed, I cannot cause it to return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has no regard for evil in Jacob,
and he does not see trouble in Israel;
    Yahweh his God is with him,
and a shout of a king is among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, who brings them out from Egypt,
is like the strength of a wild ox for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because there is no sorcery against Jacob,
and there is no divination against Israel.
    Now it will be said to Jacob and Israel,
    what God has done!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look! the people will rise like the lion;
    he raises himself and will not lie down
until he eats the prey
    and drinks the blood of the slain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak said to Balaam, “Do not curse them at all, nor bless them at all!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Balaam answered and said to Balak, “Did I not speak to you, saying, ‘Whatever Yahweh speaks I will do’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak said to Balaam, “Please, come, I will take you to another place; perhaps it will be acceptable to God, and you will curse for me from there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, which looks down on the face of the Jeshimon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said to Balak, “Build for me these seven altars, and prepare for me these seven bulls and seven rams.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak did just as Balaam said, and he offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam saw that it pleased Yahweh to bless Israel, and he did not go as other times to seek out sorcery; instead, he set his face toward the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam lift up his eyes, and he saw Israel dwelling according to its tribes, and the spirit of God was upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He uttered his oracle and said,
“The declaration of Balaam son Beor,
    the declaration of the man whose eyes are closed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the declaration of the hearer of God’s words,
    who sees the revelation of Shaddai,
falling down but whose eyes are uncovered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How good are your tents, O Jacob,
your dwellings, O Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are spread out like valleys,
like gardens on a river,
    like aloes planted by Yahweh,
like cedars at the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will pour water from his buckets,
and his offspring will be like many waters;
    his king will be higher than Agag,
and his kingdom will be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He crouches, he lies down like a lion,
    and like a lioness, who will rouse him?
They who bless you will be blessed,
    and they who curse you will be cursed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak became angry with Balaam, and he clapped his hands and said to Balaam, “I called you to curse my enemies, but look, you have surely blessed them these three times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Flee to your place now. I said I would richly honor you, but look, Yahweh has withheld honor from you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam said to Balak, “Did I not speak to your messengers whom you sent to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If Balak gave to me the fullness of his house full of silver and gold, I am not able to go beyond the command of Yahweh to do good or evil, from my heart; what Yahweh speaks, I will speak’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, look, I am about to go to my people; I will advise you what this people will do to your people in the following days.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he uttered his oracle and said,
“The declaration of Balaam son of Beor,
    and the declaration of the man whose eye is closed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the declaration of the hearer of God’s words,
    and the knower of the knowledge of the Most High,
who sees the vision of Shaddai,
    who is falling, and his eyes are revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Someone from Jacob will rule
and will destroy a remnant from the city.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he looked at Amalek, uttered his oracle, and said,
“Amalek is first of the nations,
    but his future will be forever ruin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless, the Kenite will be burned;
    how long will Asshur keep you captive?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Again he uttered his oracle and said,
“Woe, who will live when God establishes this?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Then Balaam got up and went and returned to his place, and Balak also went on his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Israel dwelled in Shittim, the people began to prostitute themselves with the daughters of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they invited the people to the sacrifices of their gods, and the people ate and worshiped their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Israel was joined together to Baal Peor, and Yahweh became angry with Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Moses, “Take all the leaders of the people and kill them before the sun, so the fierce anger of Yahweh will turn from Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses said to the judges of Israel, “Each of you kill his men who are joined together with Baal Peor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a man from the Israelites came and brought to his brothers a Midianite woman before the eyes of Moses and before the eyes of all of the community of the Israelites, and they were weeping at the doorway of the tent of assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Phinehas son of Eleazar son of Aaron the priest saw, he got up from the midst of the community and took a spear in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went after the man of Israel into the woman’s section of the tent, and he drove the two of them, the man of Israel and the woman, into her belly. And the plague among the Israelites stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ones who died in the plague were twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Phinehas son of Eleazar, son of Aaron the priest, turned away my anger from among the Israelites when he was jealous with my jealousy in their midst, and I did not destroy the Israelites with my jealousy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore say, ‘Behold, I am giving to him my covenant of peace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it will be for him and his offspring after him a covenant of an eternal priesthood because he was jealous for his God and made atonement for the Israelites.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the man of Israel who was struck with the Midianite woman was Zimri son of Salu, a leader of the family of the Simeonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the Midianite woman who was struck was Cozbi daughter of Zur, a leader of a tribe of the family in Midian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Attack the Midianites and strike them
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they were attacking you with their deception, with which they have deceived you on the matter of Peor and on the matter of Cozbi the daughter of the leader of Midian, their sister who was struck on the day of the plague because of the matter of Peor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened after the plague, Yahweh said to Moses and to Eleazar son of Aaron the priest, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a census of the community of the Israelites from those twenty years old and above, according to their families, all who are able to go out to war in Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Eleazar the priest spoke with them on the desert-plateau of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Take a census of the community from those twenty years old and above, just as Yahweh commanded Moses.”
The Israelites who went out from the land of Egypt were:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reuben, the firstborn of Israel, the descendants of Reuben: of Hanoch, the clan of the Hanochites; of Pallu, the clan of the Palluites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Hezron, the clan of the Hezronites; of Carmi, the clan of the Carmites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the clans of the Reubenites, and the ones counted of them were forty-three thousand seven hundred and thirty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Pallu: Eliab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Eliab: Nemuel, Dathan, and Abiram. These are the same Dathan and Abiram who were appointed of the community, who rebelled against Moses and Aaron in the company of Korah, when they rebelled against Yahweh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the land opened its mouth and swallowed them with Korah, when that company died, when the fire consumed two hundred and fifty men, and they were a sign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Korah, however, did not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Simeon, according to their clans: of Nemuel, the clan of the Nemuelites; of Jamin, the clan of the Jaminites; of Jakin, the clan of the Jakinites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Zerah, the clan of the Zerahites; of Shaul, the clan of the Shaulites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the clans of the Simeonites, twenty-two thousand two hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Gad according to their clans: of Zephon, the clan of the Zephonites; of Haggi, the clan of the Haggites; of Shuni, the clan of the Shunites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Ozni, the clan of the Oznites; of Eri, the clan of the Erites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Arod, the clan of the Arodites; of Areli, the clan of the Arelites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the clans of the descendants of Gad according to the ones counted of them, forty thousand five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Judah: Er and Onan; but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Judah according to their clans were: of Shelah, the clan of the Shelanites; of Perez, the clan of the Perezites; of Zerah, the clan of the Zerahites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Perez were: of Hezron, the clan of the Hezronites; of Hamul, the clan of the Hamulites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the clans of Judah according to the ones counted of them, seventy-six thousand five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Issachar according to their clans: of Tola, the clan of the Tolaites; of Puvah, the clan of the Punites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Jashub, the clans of the Jashubites; of Shimron, the clan of the Shimronites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the clans of Issachar according to the ones counted of them, sixty-four thousand three hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Zebulun according to their clans: of Sered, the clan of the Seredites; of Elon, the clan of the Elonites; of Jahleel, the clan of the Jahleelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the clans of the Zebulunites according to the ones counted of them, sixty thousand five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Joseph according to their clans: Manasseh and Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Manasseh: of Makir, the clan of the Makirites. And Makir fathered Gilead; of Gilead, the clan of the Gileadites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the descendants of Gilead: of Iezer, the clan of the Iezerites; of Helek, the clan of the Helekites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of Asriel, the clan of the Asrielites; and of Shechem, the clan of the Shechemites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of Shemida, the clan of the Shemidaites; and of Hepher, the clan of the Hepherites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zelophehad son of Hepher did not have sons, but only daughters; and the names of the daughters of Zelophehad were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the clans of Manasseh, and the ones counted of them were fifty-two thousand seven hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the descendants of Ephraim according to their clans: of Shuthelah, the clan of the Shuthelahites; of Beker, the clan of the Bekerites; of Tahan, the clan of the Tahanites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these were the descendants of Shuthelah: of Eran, the family of the Eranites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the clans of the descendants of Ephraim according to the ones counted of them, thirty-two thousand five hundred. These were the descendants of Joseph according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Benjamin according to their clans: of Bela, the clan of the Belaites; of Ashbel, the clan of the Ashbelites; of Ahiram, the clan of the Ahiramites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Shephupham, the clan of the Shuphamites; of Hupham, the clan of the Huphamites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman: of Ard, the clan of the Ardites; of Naaman, the clan of the Naamites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the descendants of Benjamin according to their clans. And the ones counted of them were forty-five thousand six hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the descendants of Dan according to their clans: of Shuham, the clan of the Shuhamites. These were the clans of Dan according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the clans of the Shuhamites, according to the ones counted of them, were sixty-four thousand four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Asher according to their clans: of Imnah, the clan of the Imnahites; of Ishvi, the clan of the Ishvites; of Beriah, the clan of the Beriahites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Beriah: of Heber, the clan of the Heberites; of Malkiel, the clan of the Malkielites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the daughter of Asher was Serah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the clans of the descendants of Asher according to the ones counted of them, fifty-three thousand four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Naphtali according to their clans: of Jahzeel, the clan of the Jahzeelites; of Guni, the clan of the Gunites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Jezer, the clan of the Jezerites; of Shillem, the clan of the Shillemites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the clans of Naphtali according to their clans, the ones counted of them, forty-five thousand four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the ones counted of the Israelites, six hundred and one thousand seven hundred and thirty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For these the land must be divided as an inheritance according to the number of names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the larger group you must increase their inheritance, and for the smaller group you must make smaller their inheritance; each must be given their inheritance according to the number of the ones counted of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely the land will be divided by lot. They will inherit according to the names of the tribes of their ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their inheritance must be divided according to the lot between the larger and smaller groups.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the ones counted of the Levites according to their clans: of Gershon, the clan of the Gershonites; of Kohath, the clan of the Kohathites; of Merari, the clan of the Merarites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the clans of Levi: the clan of the Libnites, the clan of the Hebronites, the clan of the Mahlites, the clan of the Mushites, the clan of the Korahites. Kohath fathered Amram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the wife of Amram was Jochebed, the daughter of Levi, whose mother bore her for Levi in Egypt; she bore to Amram: Aaron and Moses and their sister Miriam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Aaron were born Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Nadab and Abihu died when they presented strange fire before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ones counted were twenty-three thousand, every male from a month old and above, because they were not counted in the midst of the Israelites since no inheritance was given to them in the midst of the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the ones counted by Moses and Eleazar the priest, who counted the Israelites on the desert-plateau of Moab on the Jordan across Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator
