verses.text: And among these there was not a man of those counted by Moses and Aaron the priest, who counted the Israelites in the desert of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh said to them, “They will surely die in the desert.” And not a man was left over from them, except Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the daughters of Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Makir, the son of Manasseh, of the clan of Manasseh the son of Joseph, came near; and these were the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, and Tirzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They stood before Moses and before Eleazar the priest and before the leaders of the entire community at the doorway of the tent of assembly, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Our father died in the desert; he was not in the midst of the company of those who banded together against Yahweh in the company of Korah, but he died in his own sin, and he had no sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should the name of our father disappear from the midst of his clan because he does not have a son? Give us property in the midst of the brothers of our father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses brought their case before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The statements of the daughters of Zelophehad are right. You must surely give them the property of an inheritance in the midst of their father’s brothers, and you must transfer the inheritance of their father to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you must speak to the Israelites, saying, ‘If a man dies and has no son, you must transfer his inheritance to his daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he has no daughter, you must give his inheritance to his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he has no brothers, then you must give his inheritance to his father’s brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If his father has no brothers, then you must give his inheritance to his nearest relative from his own clan, and he will take possession of it. It will be as a decree of stipulation for the Israelites, just as Yahweh commanded Moses.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Moses, “Go up to this mountain of Abarim, and see the land that I have given to the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you see it, you will be gathered to your people, just as Aaron your brother was gathered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because you rebelled against my word in the desert of Zin when the community quarreled regarding my holiness at the waters.” (These are the waters of Meribah-Kadesh in the desert of Zin.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let Yahweh, the God of the spirits of all flesh, appoint a man over the community
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who will go out before them and will come in before them, and who will lead them out and bring them in, so the community of Yahweh will not be like a flock that does not have a shepherd.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh said to Moses, “Take Joshua son of Nun, a man in whom is the spirit, and place your hand on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have him stand before Eleazar the priest and before the entire community, and commission him in their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will give to him from your authority so that the entire community of Israel will obey him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will stand before Eleazar the priest, who will ask for him by the decision of the Urim before Yahweh. On his command they will go out, and at his command they will come in, both he and all of the Israelites with him, the entire community.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses did just as Yahweh commanded him, and he took Joshua and set him before Eleazar the priest and before the entire community.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he placed his hands on him and commissioned him just as Yahweh spoke by the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the Israelites and say to them, ‘You will be careful to present my offering, my food of my offerings made by fire, of a fragrance of appeasement to me, at its appointed time.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will say to them, ‘This is the offering made by fire that you will offer to Yahweh: two male lambs without defect in their first year as a continual burnt offering each day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will offer one male lamb in the morning, and the second male lamb you will offer at twilight,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a tenth of an ephah of finely milled flour as a grain offering, mixed with a fourth of a measure of beaten oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a continual burnt offering that was ordained on Mount Sinai as a fragrance of appeasement, an offering made by fire for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The libation with it will be a fourth of a liquid measure for each male lamb; in the sanctuary you will pour out the libation of fermented drink for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the second male lamb you will offer at twilight; as the grain offering of the morning and as its libation you will offer it, an offering made by fire, a fragrance of appeasement for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the day of the Sabbath, two male lambs without defect in their first year, and two-tenths of finely milled flour mixed with oil for a grain offering and its libation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the burnt offering every Sabbath in addition to the continual burnt offering and its libation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And at the beginning of each of your months, you will present a burnt offering for Yahweh: two bulls and one ram, seven male lambs without defect in their first year;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and three-tenths of finely milled flour mixed with oil for a grain offering, for each bull; and two-tenths of finely milled flour mixed with oil for a grain offering for the one ram;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a tenth of finely milled flour mixed with oil as a grain offering for each male lamb, for a burnt offering of a fragrance of appeasement, an offering of fire for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their libations will be half a liquid measure of wine for the bull and a third of a liquid measure of wine for the ram and a fourth of a liquid measure of wine for the male lamb; this is the burnt offering for every month for the months of the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one male goat as a sin offering for Yahweh; it will be offered in addition to the continual burnt offering and its libation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the fourteenth day of the first month is the Passover for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fifteenth day of this month is a religious feast, unleavened bread must be eaten for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day there will be a holy convocation; you will not do any regular work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will present an offering by fire, a burnt offering for Yahweh: two bulls and one ram and seven male lambs in their first year; they will be for you without defect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For their grain offering, you will offer finely milled flour mixed with oil: three-tenths for the bull and two-tenths for the ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will offer a tenth for each of the seven male lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a goat for one sin offering to make atonement for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will offer these besides the burnt offering of the morning, which is for the continual burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like this you will offer daily, for seven days, the food of the offering made by fire, a fragrance of appeasement for Yahweh; it will be offered in addition to the continual burnt offering and its libation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day you will have a holy convocation; you will not do any regular work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And on the day of firstfruits, when you are presenting a new offering for Yahweh during your Festival of Weeks, you will have a holy convocation; you will not do any regular work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will present a burnt offering for a fragrance of appeasement for Yahweh: two bulls, one ram, seven male lambs in their first year;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their grain offering will be finely milled flour mixed with oil: three-tenths for each bull, two-tenths for one ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a tenth for each of the male lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat to make atonement for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In addition to the continual burnt offering and its grain offering, you will offer them without defect with their libation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you will have a holy convocation; you will not do any regular work. It will be a day for you of blowing trumpets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will offer a burnt offering as a fragrance of appeasement for Yahweh: one bull, one ram, and seven male lambs in their first year; they will be without defect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their grain offering will be finely milled flour mixed with oil: three-tenths for the bull, two-tenths for the ram;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one-tenth for each of the seven male lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with one male goat for a sin offering, to make atonement for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in addition to the burnt offering of the new moon and its grain offering, the continual burnt offering and its grain offering, and their libations, according to their stipulations, as a fragrance of appeasement by fire for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And on the tenth of this seventh month you will have a holy convocation, and you will afflict yourselves; you will not do any work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will present a burnt offering for Yahweh, a fragrance of appeasement: one bull, one ram, seven male lambs in their first year; they will be without defect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their grain offering will be of finely milled flour mixed with oil: three-tenths for the bull, two-tenths for the one ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one-tenth for each of the seven male lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the sin offering of atonement and the continual burnt offering and its grain offering, and their libations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Then on the fifteenth day of the seventh month you will have a holy convocation; you will not do any regular work, and you will hold a religious feast for Yahweh for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will present a burnt offering, an offering made by fire as a fragrance of appeasement for Yahweh: thirteen bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs in their first year; they will be without defect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their grain offering will be of finely milled flour mixed with oil: three-tenths for the bull, two-tenths for the one ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one-tenth for each of the seven male lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the continual burnt offering, its grain offering, and its libation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the second day: twelve bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs in their first year; they will be without defect;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their grain offering and their libations for the bulls, for the rams, and for the male lambs, by their number according to the stipulation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the continual burnt offering and its grain offering, and their libations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the third day: eleven bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs without defect in their first year;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their grain offering and their libations for the bulls, for the rams, and for the male lambs, by their number according to the stipulation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the continual burnt offering, its grain offering, and its libation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the fourth day: ten bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs without defect in their first year;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their grain offering and their libations for the bulls, for the rams, and for the male lambs by their number according to the stipulation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the continual burnt offering, its grain offering, and its libation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the fifth day: nine bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs without defect in their first year;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their grain offering and their libations for the bulls, for the rams, and for the male lambs by their number according to the stipulation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the continual burnt offering, its grain offering, and its libation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the sixth day: eight bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs without defect in their first year; and their grain offering and their libations for the bulls, for the rams, and for the male lambs by their number according to the stipulation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their grain offering and their libations for the bulls, for the rams, and for the male lambs by their number according to the stipulation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the continual burnt offering, its grain offering, and its libation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the seventh day: seven bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs without defect in their first year;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their grain offering and their libations for the bulls, for the rams, and for the male lambs by their number according to the stipulation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the continual burnt offering, its grain offering, and its libation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the eighth day you will have an assembly; you will not do any regular work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will present a burnt offering, an offering made by fire as a fragrance of appeasement for Yahweh: one bull, one ram, seven male lambs without defect in their first year;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their grain offering and their libations for the bulls, for the rams, and for the male lambs by their number according to the stipulation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the continual burnt offering, its grain offering, and its libation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You will present these to Yahweh at your appointed time, in addition to your vows and your freewill offerings, for your burnt offerings and for you grain offerings and for your libations and for your fellowship offerings.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses said to the Israelites in accordance with all that Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses spoke to the leaders of the tribes concerning the Israelites, saying, “This is the word that Yahweh commanded:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if a man makes a vow for Yahweh or swears an oath with a binding pledge on himself, he must not render his word invalid; he must do all that went out from his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a woman makes a vow to Yahweh, and she binds a pledge on herself in her father’s house in your childhood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if her father hears her vow or her pledge that she bound on herself and says nothing to her, then all her vows will stand, and every pledge that she binds on her life will stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If her father forbids her on the day he hears of it, all her vows or her pledges that she bound on herself will not stand, and Yahweh will forgive her because her father has forgiven her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If she has a husband while bound by her vows or a rash promise of her lips,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her husband hears of it and is silent on the day he hears it, her vows will stand, and her pledge that she bound upon herself will stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if on the day her husband hears of it, he forbids her, then he will nullify her vow that she is under, and the rash promise of her lips that she bound on herself; and Yahweh will forgive her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the vow of a widow or a woman who is divorced, all that she binds on herself will stand on her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if she made a vow in her husband’s house, or bound herself on a pledge with a sworn oath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her husband heard it but was silent to her, and he did not forbid her, all her vows will stand and every pledge that she bound on herself will stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her husband nullified them on the day he hears them, all her vows going out of her lips concerning her vows or the pledge on herself will not stand; her husband has nullified them, and Yahweh will forgive her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Any vow and any sworn oath of a pledge to inflict on herself, her husband can confirm it or her husband can nullify it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her husband is completely silent from day to day, then he confirms all her vows or all her pledges that are on her; he confirms them because he was silent to her on the day he heard them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he indeed nullifies them after he hears them, then he will bear her guilt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the decrees that Yahweh commanded Moses, as between a husband and his wife, and between a father and his daughter, while her childhood is in her father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Seek vengeance for the Israelites on the Midianites; afterward you will be gathered to your people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses spoke to the people, saying, “Arm yourself from among your men for the battle, so that they will go against Midian to mete out the vengeance of Yahweh on Midian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A thousand from each tribe of every tribe of Israel you will send to battle.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So theywere assigned from the thousands of Israel, a thousand from each tribe, twelve thousand equipped for battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses sent them, a thousand from each tribe, to the battle, and Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest to the battle with them, and the vessels of the sanctuary and the trumpets of the blast were in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they fought against Midian just as Yahweh commanded Moses, and they killed every male.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They killed the kings of Midian in addition to the ones they had slain: Evi and Rekem and Zur and Hur and Reba, the five kings of Midian; they also killed Balaam son of Beor by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelites took captive the women of Midian and their children, and they plundered all their domestic animals and all their livestock and all their wealth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They burned all their cities where they dwelled and all their camps with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took all the plunder and all the war-booty with the humans and domestic animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the captives, the war-booty, and the plunder to Moses, and to Eleazar the priest, and to the community of the Israelites, to the camp to the desert-plateau of Moab, which was on the Jordan across Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Eleazar the priest and all the leaders of the community went out to meet them outside the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses was angry toward the leaders of the troops, the commanders of the thousands and the commanders of the hundreds, who came from the battle of the war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to them, “You have kept alive every female?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, these women caused the Israelites, by the word of Balaam, to be in apostasy against Yahweh in the matter of Peor, so that the plague was among the community of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now kill every male among the little children, and kill every woman who has had sexual intercourse with a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all the females who have not had sexual intercourse with a man, keep alive for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, camp outside the camp seven days; all who killed a person and all who touched the slain purify yourselves on the third day and on the seventh day, you and your captives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will purify yourselves and every garment and every object of hide and all the work of goats’ hair, and every object of wood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eleazar the priest said to the men of the battle who came from the war, “This is the decree of the law that Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only the gold and the silver, the bronze, the iron, the tin, and the lead—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: everything that will go through the fire—you will pass through the fire, and it will be clean, and only in waters of impurity will it be purified. Whatever does not go into the fire you will pass through the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will wash your garments on the seventh day and be clean, and afterward you will come into the camp.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You and Eleazar the priest and the leaders of the families of the community, take count of the war-booty that was captured, both humans and the domestic animals;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: divide the war-booty between those who engaged in the war, who went out to the battle, and all the community.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Exact a tribute for Yahweh from the men of the war, those who went out to the battle, one from five hundred persons, and from the cattle and from the male donkeys and from the flock;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: take from their half and give it to Eleazar the priest as a contribution to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From half of the Israelites, take one share drawn by lot from the fifty from the humans, from the cattle, from the male donkeys, from the flock, from all the domestic animals, and give them to the Levities who keep the responsibilities of the tabernacle of Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Eleazar the priest did just as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the war-booty that remained of the plunder that the people of the battle plundered was six hundred and seventy-five thousand flocks of sheep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: seventy-two thousand cattle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: sixty-one thousand male donkeys,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the life of humankind, from the women who did not have sexual intercourse with a man, all the persons were thirty-two thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The half of the share that was going out to the battle: the number of the flock of sheep was thee hundred and thirty-seven thousand five hundred;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the tribute to Yahweh from the flock was six hundred and seventy-five;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the cattle were thirty-six thousand; and the tribute to Yahweh was seventy-two.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the male donkeys there were thirty thousand five hundred, and the tribute to Yahweh was sixty-one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the humans were sixteen thousand, and the tribute to Yahweh was thirty-two persons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses gave away the tribute of the contribution of Yahweh to Eleazar the priest, just as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the half of the Israelites, which Moses divided from the men who were fighting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the half that belonged to the community was three hundred and thirty-seven thousand five hundred from the flock,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thirty-six thousand cattle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thirty thousand five hundred male donkeys,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sixteen thousand humans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the half that belonged to the Israelites, Moses took one share drawn by lot out of every fifty humans and domestic animals, and he gave them to the Levites, who keep the responsibility of the tabernacle of Yahweh, just as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the leaders of the thousands of the army, the commanders of the thousands and the commanders of the hundreds, approached Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they said to Moses, “Your servants have taken count of the men of war who were in our charge, and no man is missing from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we brought the offering of Yahweh, what each man found, objects of gold, bangles, bracelets, rings, earrings, and female ornaments, to make atonement for ourselves before Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold from them, all objects of work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the gold of the contribution that they raised up to Yahweh, from the commanders of the thousands and the commanders of the hundreds, was sixteen thousand seven hundred and fifty shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of battle plundered each for himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold from the commanders of the thousands and hundreds, and they brought it to the tent of the assembly as a memorial for the Israelites before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Reuben and the descendants of Gad had a very large number of livestock. And they saw the land of Jazer and the land of Gilead, and behold it was a place for livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Gad and the descendants of Reuben came, and they said to Moses and to Eleazar the priest and to the leaders of the community, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo, and Beon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the land that Yahweh struck before the community of Israel, is a land of livestock, and your servants have livestock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “If we have found favor in your sight, let this land be given to your servants as property; do not lead us across the Jordan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said to the descendants of Gad and to the descendants of Reuben, “Will your brothers go to war while you yourselves live here?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why are you discouraging the hearts of the Israelites from crossing into the land that Yahweh gave to them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what your fathers did when I sent them from Kadesh Barnea to see the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they went up to the valley of Eshcol and saw the land, they discouraged the heart of the Israelites so that they did not come to the land that Yahweh gave to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Yahweh’s anger burned on that day, and he swore an oath, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The men who went up from Egypt, from those twenty years old and above, will not see the land that I swore with an oath to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob because they have not wholly followed me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: except Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite and Joshua son of Nun, because they followed Yahweh wholly.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh became angry, and he made them wander in the desert forty years until the entire generation who did evil in the sight of Yahweh had died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, you stand in the place of your fathers, a brood of sinful men, to increase still more Yahweh’s fierce anger against Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you turn from following him, he will again abandon them in the wilderness, and you would have destroyed all these people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came near to him and said, “We will build sheep pens here for the flock of our livestock and cities for our little children;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but we ourselves will become armed and ready before the Israelites until we have brought them to their place, and our little children will live in the fortified cities because of the inhabitants of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will not return to our houses until the Israelites each obtain their inheritance for themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we will not take possession with them from across the Jordan and beyond because our inheritance has come to us from across the Jordan to the east.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses said to them, “If you do this thing, if you arm yourselves before Yahweh for the war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and everyone of you armed cross the Jordan before Yahweh until he has driven out his enemies from before him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the land is subdued before Yahweh, then afterward you will return and be free of obligation from Yahweh and from Israel, and this land will be your property before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do not do so, behold, you have sinned against Yahweh, and know that your sin will find you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Build for yourselves cities for your little children and sheep pens for your flocks; what has gone out from your mouth you will do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the descendants of Gad and the descendants of Reuben said to Moses, saying, “Your servants will do just as my lord commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our little children, our wives, our livestock, and all of our animals will remain in the cities of Gilead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but your servants, everyone who is armed for battle, will cross over before Yahweh to the war, just as my lord says.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses commanded them, Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the heads of the families of the tribes of the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to them, “If the descendants of Gad and the descendants of Reuben, everyone who is armed for the war, cross over the Jordan before Yahweh, and the land is subdued before you, you will give them the land of Gilead as property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they will not cross over with you armed, they will acquire land in your midst in Canaan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Gad and the descendants of Reuben answered and said, “What Yahweh has commanded your servants, we will do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We ourselves will cross over armed before Yahweh to the land of Canaan, and the property of our inheritance will remain with us beyond the Jordan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses gave to them, to the descendants of Gad and the descendants of Reuben, and to half of the tribe of Joseph’s son Manasseh, the kingdom of Sihon the king of Amorites and the kingdom of Og the king of the Bashan, the land with its cities and their territories, the cities of the surrounding land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Gad rebuilt Dibon, Ataroth, and Aroer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Atroth Shophan, Jazer, and Jogbehah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Beth Nimrah and Beth Haran, the cities of Mibzar, and the sheep pens for flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Reuben rebuilt Heshbon, Elealeh, and Kiriathaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Nebo, Baal Meon (their names were changed), and Sibmah, and they renamed the cities that they rebuilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Makir son of Manasseh went to Gilead, and they captured it and drove out the Amorites who were in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses gave Gilead to Makir son of Manasseh, and he lived in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jair son of Manasseh went and captured their unwalled villages, and he called them Havvoth Jair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nobah went and captured Kenath and its villages, and he called it Nobah after his own name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the journeys of the Israelites, who went out from the land of Egypt according to their divisions, by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses wrote down their movements according to their journeys on the command of Yahweh, and these are their journeys according to their movements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Rameses on the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month; on the next day after the Passover the Israelites went out boldly in the sight of all the Egyptians
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while the Egyptians were burying all the firstborn among them whom Yahweh struck. Yahweh also executed punishments among their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Israelites set out from Rameses, and they camped in Succoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They journeyed from Succoth and camped in Etham, which is on the edge of the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they set out from Etham and returned to Pi-Hahiroth, which faces Baal Zephon, and they camped before Migdol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Pi-Hahiroth and went through the midst of the sea into the desert; and they went a journey of three days into the desert of Etham and camped at Marah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Marah and came to Elim, and in Elim there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees, and they camped there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Elim, and they camped at the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from the Red Sea and camped at the desert of Sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from the desert of Sin and camped at Dophkah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Dophkah and camped at Alush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Alush and encamped at Rephidim; and it was there that the people had no water to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Rephidim and camped in the desert of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The set out from the desert of Sinai and camped at Kibroth Hattaavah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Kibroth Hattaavah and camped at Hazeroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Hazeroth and camped at Rithmah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Rithmah and camped at Rimmon Perez.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Rimmon Perez and camped at Libnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Libnah and camped at Rissah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Rissah and camped at Kehelathah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Kehelathah and camped at Mount Shapher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Mount Shapher and camped at Haradah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Haradah and camped at Makheloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Makheloth and camped at Tahath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Tahath and camped at Terah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Terah and camped at Mithcah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Mithcah and camped at Hashmonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Hashmonah and camped at Moserah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Moserah and camped at Bene-Jaakan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Bene-Jaakan and camped at Hor Haggidgad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Hor Haggidgad and camped at Jotbathah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Jotbathah and camped at Abronah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Abronah and camped at Ezion Geber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Ezion Geber and camped in the desert of Zin, that is, Kadesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Kadesh and camped at Mount Hor, at the edge of the land of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron the priest went up to Mount Hor at the command of Yahweh, and he died there in the fortieth year after the Israelites had gone out from the land of Egypt, in the fifth month on the first day of the month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron was one hundred and twenty-three years old when he died on Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Canaanite, the king of Arad, who was living in the Negev in the land of Canaan, heard of the coming of the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they set out from Mount Hor and camped at Zalmonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Zalmonah and camped at Punon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Punon and camped at Oboth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Oboth and camped at Iye Abarim, the boundary of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Iyim and camped at Dibon Gad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Dibon Gad and camped at Almon-Diblatayim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Almon-Diblatayim and camped in the mountains of Abarim, before Nebo.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from the mountains of Abarim and camped on the desert-plateau of Moab by the Jordan across Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They camped by the Jordan, from Beth-Jeshimoth up to Abel Shittim, on the desert-plateau of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses on the desert-plateau of Moab by the Jordan across Jericho, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the Israelites and say to them, ‘When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you will drive out the inhabitants of the land from your presence, and you will destroy all their idols and all the images of their molten idols, and you will demolish all their high places;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you will dispossess the land and live in it because I have given the land to you to possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will distribute the land by lot according to your clans; to the larger group you will give a larger inheritance, and to the smaller group you will give less inheritance. However the lot falls for him, there the lot will be. You will distribute it according to the tribes of your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land from your presence, then it will happen that whomever you let remain of them will be like irritants in your eyes and like thorns in your sides; they will be your enemies in the land in which you live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And just as I planned to do to them, I will do to you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the Israelites and say to them, ‘When you come into the land of Canaan, this is the land that was allotted to you as an inheritance, the land of Canaan according to its boundaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your southern edge will be from the desert of Zin toward the side of Edom, and your southern border will be from the end of the Salt Sea to the east;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: your boundary will turn from the south to the ascent of Akrabbim and will pass over to Zin, and its limits will be from the south of Kadesh Barnea; it will continue to Hazar Addar and pass over to Azmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The boundary will turn from Azmon to the valley of Egypt, and its limits will be to the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Your western boundary will be the Great Sea; this will be your western boundary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your northern border will be from the Great Sea; you will make a boundary from the Great Sea to Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Mount Hor you will make a boundary to reach Hamath; the limits of the territory will be at Zedad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The boundary will go out to Ziphron, and its limits will be at Hazar Enan. This will be your boundary to the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You will mark out your eastern boundary from Hazar Enan to Shepham;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the boundary will go down from Shepham to Riblah from the east side of Ain, and the boundary will go down and border on the eastern side of the Sea of Kinnereth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The boundary will go down to the Jordan, and its limits will be at the Salt Sea. This will be your land according to its boundaries all around.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses commanded the Israelites, saying, “This is the land that you will obtain as an inheritance for yourself by lot, which Yahweh commanded to give to the nine and a half tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the tribe of the children of the Reubenites, the children of the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh took their inheritance according to the house of their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two and a half tribes have taken their inheritance from beyond the Jordan across Jericho, east toward the sunrise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the names of the men who divide up the land for your inheritance: Eleazar the priest and Joshua son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will take one leader from every tribe to divide up the land for inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the men: of the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the tribe of the descendants of Simeon, Samuel son of Ammihud;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad son of Chislon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the tribe of the descendants of Dan, the leader Bukki son of Jogli;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the descendants of Joseph, the tribe of the descendants of Manasseh, the leader Hanniel son of Ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of the descendants of Ephraim, the leader Kemuel son of Shiphtan;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the tribe of the descendants of Zebulum, the leader Elizaphan son of Parnach;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the tribe of the descendants of Issachar, the leader Paltiel son of Azzan;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the tribe of the descendants of Asher, the leader Ahihud son of Shelomi;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the tribe of the descendants of Naphtali, the leader Pedahel son of Ammihud.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are those whom Yahweh commanded to allot to the Israelites the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses on the desert plains of Moab beyond the Jordan across Jericho, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the Israelites that they give to the Levites from the inheritance of their property cities to live in; and you will give to the Levites pastureland all around the cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cities will be theirs to live in, and their pasturelands will be for their domestic animals, for their possessions, and their animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The pasturelands of the cities that you will give to the Levites will extend from the wall of the city to a distance of a thousand cubits all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will measure outside the city the eastern edge two thousand cubits, for the southern edge two thousand cubits, for the western edge two thousand cubits, and for the northern edge two thousand cubits, with the city in the middle; this will be for them the pasturelands of the cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All the cities that you will give the Levites will be six cities of refuge, to which the killer can flee; in addition to them you will give forty-two cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the cities that you will give to the Levites will be forty-eight cities, them with their pasturelands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the cities that you will give from the property of the Israelites, you will take more from the larger group and less from the smaller group; each of them will give according to the portion of their inheritance according to the portion that he inherits.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the Israelites and say to them, ‘When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you will select for yourselves cities for your cities of refuge, that a killer who has killed a person unintentionally can flee there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cities will be to you a refuge from a redeemer, so that the killer will not die until he stands before the community for judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cities that you are to give will be your six cities of refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will give three cities across the Jordan and three cities in the land of Canaan; they will be cities of refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the Israelites, to the alien, and to the temporary resident in their midst there will be these six cities as a refuge to which anyone who unintentionally kills a person may flee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘But if he hit him with an object of iron, so that he dies, the killer must surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he hit him with a stone in the hand, by which he will die, and he does die, he is a killer; the killer must surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if he hit him with a wooden object, by which he will die, and he does die, he is a killer; the killer must surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The blood avenger himself will put the killer to death; he must put him to death when meeting him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he shoves him in hatred, or he throws something at him with intention, and he dies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or if he hits him in hostility with his hand, and he dies, the one that struck him will put to death the killer when meeting him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Or if in an instant he shoved him, not in hostility, or threw something at him without intention,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or with any stone, without seeing it dropped on him so that he dies, while he was not seeking his injury,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the community will judge between the striker and between the blood avenger according to these ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The community will deliver the killer from the hand of the blood avenger, and the community will restore him to the city of his refuge to which he fled; and he will live there in it until the death of the high priest who was anointed with holy oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the killer surely goes out of the territory of the city of his refuge to which he fled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the blood avenger finds him outside the territory of the city of his refuge, and the blood avenger kills the killer, he will not be guilty of blood
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he must live in the city of his refuge until the death of the high priest. But after the death of the high priest the killer will return to the land of his property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things will be as a decree of justice for you for your generations in all your dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘If anyone kills a person, the killer will be put to death according to the testimony of witnesses, but someone cannot die on testimony of one person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, you will not take a ransom payment for the life of a killer who is guilty of death; indeed, he must surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will not take a ransom payment for the one that flees to the city of his refuge, so that he may return to live in the land before the death of the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you will not pollute the land in which you are; because blood pollutes the land, and no atonement can be made for the land for the blood that is poured out on it except with the blood of the one who poured it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will not defile the land on which you are living because I am living in the midst of it; I am Yahweh; I am living in the midst of the Israelites.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leaders of the families of the clans of descendants of Gilead the son of Makir, the son of Manasseh, of the clans of the descendants of Joseph came near and spoke before Moses and before the leaders of the families of the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “Yahweh commanded my lord to give the land by lot as an inheritance to the Israelites, and my lord was commanded by Yahweh to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother to his daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they become wives to one of the sons from another tribe of the Israelites, their inheritance will disappear from the inheritance of our ancestors, and it will be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they belong; the lot of our inheritance would disappear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Jubilee of the Israelites comes, it will be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they belong; and their inheritance will disappear from the tribe of our father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses commanded the Israelites by the command of Yahweh, saying, “The tribe of the descendants of Joseph is right regarding what they are speaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that Yahweh commanded the daughters of Zelophehad, saying, ‘Let them marry whomever they like; only they must marry from within the clan of the tribe of their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus an inheritance of the Israelites will not go around from tribe to tribe. Rather, the inheritance of each tribe of his father will remain with the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every daughter who possesses an inheritance from the tribes of the Israelites will marry one of the clan of the tribe of her father, so that the Israelites will possess the inheritance of his ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore an inheritance will not go around from one tribe to another tribe because the tribes of the Israelites will each hold to their own inheritance.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as Yahweh commanded to Moses, so the daughters of Zelophehad did:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, married the sons of their uncles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They married those from the sons of Manasseh son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained among the tribe of the clan of their ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the commands and the stipulations that Yahweh commanded by the hand of Moses to the Israelites on the desert-plateaus of Moab by the Jordan across Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator
